industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


The AWS Networking organization is hiring, and we’re looking for talented Network Development Engineers (NDE) to join our team. Within Networking, we’re confronting and solving complex and high-stake challenges. Our teams support all aspects of connectivity to/from Amazon and the outside world, as well as the connectivity between Amazon’s data centers and services. As a member of one our network engineering teams, you will play a part in designing and architecting networks that simply cannot fail, must scale infinitely, and can never constrain growth or innovation.

This opportunity sits within our Internet Services organization where the team is responsible for designing the networks connecting Amazon directly to the outside world (including the Internet, peers, and external customers), evolving the global backbone that interconnects our Regions as well as partnering with our internal customers. Engineers in this organization define routing policy, design and implement Traffic Engineering solutions, as well as architect the hardware platforms and network design to support internal and external connectivity. We move terabits of traffic in and out of our networks each day and are responsible for the ingress and egress points of traffic entering and leaving Amazon as well as the entirety of all internal and customer traffic that rides our global backbone. Engineers on this team make day-to-day and strategic decisions that carry a huge amount of responsibility and impact.



Responsibilities



As a Network Development Engineer at Amazon, your core job responsibility is to design network topologies, architectures, and services that solve for many requirements. We listen to our customers (both internal and external), but we also listen to our teams. Our Engineers contribute materially to each team’s roadmap, and constantly help us to determine what’s most important. Together, you and your leadership team will decide on the projects that best support your team’s mission. You will have the resources and time necessary to understand, scope, and deliver these solutions. The primary area of responsibility you and your team will have is to design ahead of customer or technology needs, always predicting and solving for problems that have not yet occurred. This takes the form of creating and defending High Level Design (HLD) documents, working with vendors or internal stakeholders to influence technology roadmaps, constructing and testing your solutions, and providing support to the teams that will deploy and operate these designs. Our teams also serve as technical escalation points in support of our very talented operations teams.

We’re interested in engineers with experience having designed, operated, and implemented networks of very large scale, and those well versed in the operation of the Internet routing hierarchy. Candidates should understand the theory behind and have deep operational knowledge of routing protocols with particular emphasis on their impact to hardware platforms. We’re looking for those who have pushed platforms to their limits, understand how to work within the limitations imposed by third-party software and how to avoid them through your designs.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.




Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience is mandatory.

 IP networking fundamentals and experience in the application of IP protocols as well as network analysis fundamentals and troubleshooting skills.

 (Troubleshooting traffic engineering using BGP and large scale network design and maintenance is critical.)

 Experience with major internet routing protocols; specifically BGP (including route reflector topologies), OSPF, ISIS, MPLS and RSVP.

 Experience managing large projects to completion is a must, either as project manager or lead. NDEs are expected to self-manage several projects at a time, providing regular status updates and identifying and pushing through obstacles.




Preferred Qualifications




 Candidates should have a minimum of 7 years industry experience in a similar environment e.g ISP, peering and exchange, and large (IP) carrier networks.

 Background in high availability, global backbone design and architecture is highly preferred.

 Unix/Linux skills and the ability to script in Python, Perl, shell, C or C++ is desirable, SDN is a reality in AWS Networking. Daily activities will involve applying networking knowledge to SDN and Network Automation tools.

 Certifications (e.g. CCIE, JNCIE) a huge plus.

 Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role

 Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers a broad set of global compute, storage, database, analytics, application, and networking services that help organizations move faster, lower IT costs, and scale applications. Our services are trusted by the largest enterprises and the hottest startups to power a wide variety of workloads. The AWS Internet Edge team delivers solutions that provide customers the ability to get their services closer to their customers, increasing availability and reducing latency for critical applications and cloud platforms across the globe.

Our ideal candidate is highly autonomous, possesses strong written and verbal communication skills, strong project management and time management skills and has a successful track record of designing and delivering simple, scalable solutions. The desire and ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment is essential. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with some of the best engineers in the industry and help shape the direction of one of the largest and fastest growing cloud networks in the world.



Responsibilities




 As a Network Development Engineer working in AWS Networking you will have end to end ownership (architecture/design/scale) of our current and newly developing networks

 Lead the design of highly available ultra-scale networks and tools, driving them from concept to launch

 Define and influence strategy within and outside the team

 Lead project teams to deliver impactful benefits to our customers

 Work closely with our software developers to fully automate network operations

 Drive operational excellence projects to improve network performance and reliability

 Troubleshoot complex problems and develop innovative solutions

 Mentor and coach junior engineers

 Review and implement changes on the network





Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor’s Degree in a technology related field or equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree

 7+ years professional experience working in large scale networking environments.

 7+ years with internet routing protocols and concepts: TCP/IP, BGP, MPLS, ISIS and/or OSPF

 7+ years with network operating systems such as Cisco IOS and Junos.

7+ years working in a Linux/Unix environment

 3+ years experience in automating network tasks via Bash/shell or Perl/Python.




Preferred Qualifications




 Prior experience troubleshooting full path internet related issues

 Experience working with customers to diagnose a problem, and developing long term sustainable network solutions

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role

 Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

description:
The Role


The Sr. Systems Engineer will be joining the Site Reliability Engineering team.

As a member of this team, you will participate in the planning, designing and implementation of many such services. They will work closely with various business units throughout the organization, mostly development teams, to whom the team provides infrastructure in a rigorously defined set of services.

The Site Reliability Engineering team is responsible for building and maintaining DMD's cloud-based infrastructure. This involves the use of modern tools and techniques to provision, deploy, configure and monitor a wide array of technologies, from server less web applications to database clusters, traditional web-server farms and more.

The successful candidate must possess a solid foundation of technical knowledge, as well as effective oral and written communication abilities. Written communication is particularly important, given that this is a remote work opportunity. Above and beyond the requisite skill-set, the ideal candidate will take a holistic view towards infrastructure engineering, with the overarching goal of ensuring reliability of operations. Observable, reproducible, scalable and highly reliable infrastructure are of utmost importance and the SRE will endeavor to make this the de facto approach at all times.


Essential Job Functions:



Deploy and maintain critical applications on cloud based architecture

Implement automation, effective monitoring and infrastructure-as-code

Lead and assist product engineers in creating practical architectural implementation of proposed solutions

Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions

Provide clear goals for all areas of a project and develop steps to oversee their timely execution

Continuously evaluate existing systems with industry standards, and make recommendations for improvement

Help define, document, evolve, and evangelize high engineering standards and best practices across multiple areas

Collaborate and mentor other engineers throughout the company and seek to continually improve process



Skills and Qualifications:



Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent professional experience

At least five years of experience building, managing, and supporting cloud-based IT infrastructure

In-depth understanding of current security practices

Thorough knowledge of Unix and/or Linux fundamentals and system administration

Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools or technologies (notably Terraform)

Expertise with public cloud services (notably AWS)

Solid foundational knowledge of TCP/IP networking

Knowledge of source control systems and workflow (notably git)

Knowledge of modern DevOps/SRE practices

Some programming/scripting experience with at least one language (Python, Go, Javascript notably)

Windows system administration knowledge is a plus, but not required


At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at

https://jobs.iqvia.com

description:
Title:
 Network Support Engineer


Duration:
 Multiple years or Permanent


Location: ONSITE - 
Ottawa, On






Must be Eligible for Top Secret clearance (10 years residency in Canada)






The objective of this contract is to perform network development which includes the design, documentation and transition to support of new network technologies or deployments. The resources will be required to ensure that networking systems are properly developed in accordance to corporate standards. This will require the resources to perform regular reviews with subject matter experts and architects. The resources will also be required to update operational procedures and documentation when applicable.







The resources will provide the necessary technical assistance and expertise to perform the following duties as contract deliverables:

• Design and Development of routing and switching infrastructure on the networks.

• Design and Development of network security infrastructure on the networks

• Modify and prepare operational procedures & network /configuration documentation as needed.

• Provide 3rd tier support and maintenance to routing and switching infrastructure on the networks.






MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE/SKILLS;







Seven (7) years current experience (within the last ten (10) years) designing, supporting and troubleshooting physical networking infrastructure.

Experience (within the last 10 years) in designing, maintaining, supporting or deploying Fabric Attached network infrastructure

Experience (within the last 5 years) in maintaining, supporting and deploying Extreme Networks or AVAYA networking infrastructure.

Experience (within the last 10 years) in Developing, supporting and deploying network infrastructure in other government organizations with security constraints; (Must show detailed examples of experience)

Experience (within the last 5 years) in maintaining, supporting and deploying Firewalls.

Experience (within the last 5 years) in maintaining, supporting and deploying F5 BIG-IP load balancers.

Experience (within the last 3 years) developing, supporting and deploying Virtual private network solutions.

Experience (within the last 3 years) maintaining, supporting and deploying network deployments with Extreme Management Console (XMC).

Experience (within the last 3 years) maintaining, supporting and deploying virtual network components on VMware infrastructure.

Experience (within the last 5 years) creating, updating and maintaining technical documentation and network diagrams. (Must demonstrate examples of experience)

Experience (within the last 5 years) developing, supporting and deploying a Wide Area Network.

 Additional or higher CISCO or other Certifications related to networking infrastructure and network security. Copy of certificate required.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Hardware Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

With over 15,000 employees worldwide, the Microsoft Customer Experience and Success (CEnS) organization is responsible for the strategy, design, and implementation of the Microsoft end-to-end customer experience. This newly expanded organization reflects the Microsoft ambition to be known as a customer experience company, ensuring our Microsoft mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more is enabled by delighting customers and consistently exceeding their expectations in every interaction through a connected customer experience.

Microsoft has a tremendous opportunity to exceed customer expectations and drive greater customer loyalty and trust, which leads to greater satisfaction, retention, and growth. The CEnS organization is looking for people with a passion for delivering customer success to help us build a future where customers come to us, not only because we provide industry-leading products and services, and also because we provide a differentiated and connected customer experience that is rooted in our commitment to delivering on customer outcomes.

Support Engineers (SE) serve as frontline technical resources for Microsoft customers and partners via phone, email or web. They deliver unique value by collaboratively and reactively solving customer problems, providing proactive support advice, contributing to product quality and enhancements and creating self-help assets to broadly reach more customers. You will be part of a team responsible for providing an outstanding technical support experience to our business customers. From problem identification to full resolution, you will own and manage the customer experience over the phone and Web. When needed, you will collaborate with others to engage subject matter experts, Engineering (Product Groups) or Management. Your day to day job will be about providing both technical expertise (either on your own or by involving your colleagues) and about being an excellent communicator and a service oriented professional. You will be given the opportunity to become a subject matter expert in one or more areas and receive guidance and mentorship from your colleagues.



Responsibilities



Your Responsibilities


 Responsible for the customer support experience with Microsoft

 Own, troubleshoot and solve customer technical issues, using collaboration, troubleshooting best practices and transparency within and across teams (e.g. swarming)

 Identify cases that require escalation (either technically or strategically)

 Create and maintain incident management requests to product group or engineering group

 Contribute to case deflection initiatives, automation and other digital self-help assets to improve customer and engineer experience

 Provide ramp activities, knowledge sharing, technical coaching and mentoring

 Drive technical collaboration and engagement outside of CSS (Product Engineering teams, Services, Support, Regions)

 Lead or participate in building communities with peer delivery roles; may be workload or specialty specific




Qualifications



Required Qualifications


 5 years IT experience preferably in a support role (Azure or other cloud provider)

 2 years SQL developer experience. DBA considered

 SQL Server Data Warehouse / Azure Synapse or experience in RDMS or equivalent MPP cloud based databases

 TSQL, PL/SQL, Kusto (Azure Data Explorer)

 ETL Tool or equivalent such as Azure Data Factory, SQL Server Integration Services

 Strong background in network connectivity (Network +, CCNA preferred)

 Experience with one or more customer support, product support, technical support, IT Admin support, Consulting, systems development, product development, network operations, software engineering, or I.T. consulting, customer or technical support or consulting or end-user support




Preferred Qualifications




 Networking (network trace analysis, troubleshooting name resolution, virtual networks, firewall configuration)

 Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Azure HDInsight, Azure Databricks

 Azure Cosmos DB, NoSQL Services, MongoDB

 Data Lake

 Cloud Streaming technologies

 Open Source Ecosystem (Linux, Apache, etc.)

 Developer Experience: Python, Scala, R

 Big Data or Analytics Products and Services

 Identity

 Azure DevOps

 Power BI / SQL Server Analysis Services

 Data Modeling

 Experience with one or more customer support, product support, technical support, IT Admin support, Consulting, systems development, product development, network operations, software engineering, or I.T. consulting, customer or technical support or consulting or end-user support

 Adaptability, flexibility and the ability to do the right thing under pressure and tight deadlines.

 Great interpersonal and communication skills-both oral and written-and success in partnering with groups inside and outside of Microsoft.

 Self-motivated and independent thinker that routinely translates circumstances and understanding into actions that move the business forward in a measurable manner.


Ability to distill, prioritize and act on feedback from a variety of sources.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
What You’ll Do

As a part of the Research And Efficacy Team (RET) supporting Cisco Security products, you will provide security research, detection content development and support assistance. You will work towards keeping yourself abreast of the latest malware techniques on Mac OSX, Linux and Windows. You will Investigate, analyze and respond to malware incidents and collaborate with other security researchers to help address customer concerns and provide product efficacy gap guidance. You will develop security content, provide domain expertise, and perform root cause analysis of potential security incidents all to help protect customers from breaches and cyber attacks.

Who You’ll Work With

The RET secures and protect customers through phenomenal products and takes a lead in customer focus, research and delivery. We work to understand attacker tactics, techniques and procedures at the deepest levels and write detection logic to detect and prevent cyber attacks. We work with data scientists, machine learning specialists, threat hunters and software developers to identify and remediate security gaps where they exist.

Who You Are

You have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline with experience or interest in reverse engineering of malware.

A deep understanding of operating system internals and strive to understand low-level details.

Experience in analyzing network pcaps, process memory, malicious scripts and executables.

Scripting skills with knowledge of Python, Bash and Powershell.

Software development skills in C, C++ or Go.

Used Red-teaming tools such as Metasploit, CobaltStike, Powershell Empire etc.

Prior experience in sandbox technologies, threat hunting, security operations or managed defence will be preferred.

Work collaboratively in a multi-disciplinary team, providing domain expertise when needed.

Able to communicate with both internal and external parties in a clear and concise way.

Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

industries: Software Development, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Position at Absolute Software

Originally a Seattle-headquartered network security company, NetMotion was recently acquired by Absolute Software based out of Vancouver, BC. Together, we are excited about providing our customers with Absolute’s endpoint management and security, combined with NetMotion’s network security platform. Bringing together the best of both product suites will offer customers the chance to secure their workforce from top to bottom of the network, the applications, and the devices, no matter where they choose to work.

 

Alongside NetMotion’s Seattle office and Absolute’s Vancouver office, NetMotion Victoria is a fast-growing part of the organization. With over 20 people working from the modern downtown office (albeit largely remotely for the time being), it is one of the core locations for a company with big ambitions.

 


What We’re Looking For:


NetMotion Software is looking for a Sr. Network Engineer to work on our DevIT team. This team member will develop and maintain functional and secure networks for both infrastructure and R&D needs in our highly complicated test and development lab. To optimize the networks for our R&D staff, you should have excellent problem-solving skills and thorough knowledge of network administration and architecture on a physical and virtual level. If you’re also passionate about security and data protections, we’d love to chat!

 

As our Sr. Network Engineer - DevIT, you will:


Design and deploy functional networks (LAN, WLAN, WAN, SDWAN, NSX)

Configure and install software, servers, routers, and other network devices as needed for both infrastructure and development projects

Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the networking industry and how they pertain to our development and test processes.

Oversee new and existing equipment, hardware, software upgrades, patch management.

Practice network asset management, including maintenance of network component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information.

Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports on a regular basis to (upper) management.

Troubleshoot and resolve development lab tickets by troubleshooting issues that are perceived as network related in our development environments.

Work with automation engineers to automate tasks and monitor their effectiveness

Assist the IT security team in implementing and ensuring all proper security measures (e.g. access authentication and disaster recovery) are in place and working as expected with regards to our lab environments.

Communicate with our customers at a high level around networking needs.

Maintain complete technical documentation

Suggest improvements to network performance, capacity and scalability and ability to plan and implement those changes






Your Skills:



Industry-related experience as a Sr. Network Engineer

Professional certification (e.g. CCNP, CCDP, CCIE, Aruba certifications)

Proven experience with network design and capacity planning, network security principles, and general network management best practices. In-depth understanding of communication protocols (mainly TCP/IP v4 and v6) and routing protocols.

Previous experience working on HPe Procurve and Aruba switching and Fortigate firewalls strongly preferred. Experience with other vendors desired.

Strong experience working in a VMWare environment – experience with NSX desirable.

Experience using network emulation tools highly preferred (NetEM, kmax, CORE)

Cloud networking experience desired.

Familiarity with access control models, network security and BCP/DR design.

Knowledge of coding languages for scripting (e.g PowerShell, Python, Perl)

Experience with network diagnostic, monitoring and analysis tools.

Solid understanding of network operating systems

Sharp troubleshooting skills

Ability to work independently

Organizational and mentoring skills

Experience in the use of Confluence and Jira.

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field preferred.






Why Work For Us:


You’re resilient and passionate about securing the Work from Anywhere era.

So are we.




We’re in search of the best and the brightest – everyone from innovators, sellers and marketers to financers, operators and especially customer relationship managers – we’re looking for top tier talent to help us shape the next decade of security, drive innovation that enables customers with truly disruptive solutions and are dedicated to making a meaningful difference.




Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada with international offices in Victoria – BC, Seattle – WA, San Jose - CA, Boulder - CO, Ankeny – IA, Austin - TX, Reading - UK and Ho Chi Minh City – Vietnam, Absolute Software (NASDAQ: ABST) (TSX: ABST) accelerates customers’ shift to work-from-anywhere through the industry’s first self-healing Zero Trust platform, ensuring maximum security and uncompromised productivity. Only Absolute is embedded in more than half a billion devices, offering a permanent digital connection that intelligently and dynamically applies visibility, control and self-healing capabilities to endpoints, applications, and network access to ensure their cyber resilience tailored for distributed workforces. 




Our vision is to be the world’s most trusted security company – and to empower end users to connect securely and from anywhere, to all the applications they need to collaborate and get their work done, without interruptions and with an optimal network experience. Absolute currently serves approximately 16,000 customers with more than 13 million activated endpoints globally. G2 recognized Absolute as a Leader in the Winter 2022 Endpoint Management and Zero Trust Networking Grid Reports, reflecting our continued customer satisfaction across product lines. To learn more about Absolute, visit our website at 
www.absolute.com
 or visit our 
YouTube channel
.


Absolute is an equal opportunity employer.

industries: Insurance
description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.




Working Arrangement


Hybrid



Job Description



The Lead Cloud Security Requirement:


Experience integrating solutions with Cloud provider environments such as MS Azure, AWS, Google, IBM

Must have solid routing, switching, Cisco Nexus, Palo Alto, and DMZ/ISP experience.

Solid understanding of TCP/IP concepts, SDN, OSPF, BGP, VLAN, IPSEC, ISAKMP, PKI, QOS, Multicast, trunking/port-channeling, FHRP protocols, enterprise level MPLS, VDC, flavors of VPC, Fabricpath.

Experience with large scale, complex network/DMZ environments and Authentication mechanisms (e.g., Active Directory, Ping federate)

A technical security background, preferably within SIEM and other security tools (firewalls, IDS, endpoint protection, content filtering, IAM, DLP etc.).

Designs and develops security measures to ensure Cybersecurity is fully integrated. Validates current and future-state architectural models to assess impact across all Cybersecurity technology systems.

Solid knowledge and understanding of security technologies and application development methodologies.

Experience with scripting languages (preferred)




Responsibilities




Provide network security architecture expertise and work with the global network architects and engineers to define the network security policies.

Work closely with engineering teams to design globally consistent and secure network infrastructure policies and to establish and enforce policies.

Participate in and lead large-scale strategic initiatives and tool/automation implementation to advance the company's overall network security architecture and improve business outcomes.

Develop a strategic firewall security standards and frameworks using the current technology roadmap.

Provide expert network Security policies and analytical guidance for technical framework.

Identifying security integration gaps in for information security standards.


Ensure all parts of the technical design are securely incorporated and provide quality control

industries: Financial Services
description:
Head Office Toronto 
Why join us?


Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Reporting to the Manager, Network and UC Engineering, the Senior Network Engineer is the technical lead and SME for LAN, WAN, WLAN, Datacenter network and cloud network technologies within IT Infrastructure and Operations. The position is responsible for the design, implementation, management, and administration of the network infrastructure that support all business entities across the enterprise. This role requires broad and deep technical knowledge, and the ability to collaborate with technical SMEs across the enterprise to design, implement and manage highly available, scalable, and cost-effective network solutions.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for


Collaborating with network and cloud architects to implement enterprise on-prem and cloud networks.

Extensive knowledge of routing and switching including routing Protocols BGP, OSPF, EIGRP

Experience in managing datacenter network using Cisco ACI

Mentor team members to grow the skillset of the group, narrow knowledge gaps, and eliminate informational fiefdoms.

Design and configure Enterprise LAN, WAN, WLAN (MPLS, SD-WAN, Internet, etc.).

Continue to drive existing and establish new company wide standards across remote sites and data centers

Continuously improve delivery and quality of network services through scripting and automation

Troubleshoot issues and take proactive measures to reduce impact and risk of reoccurrence

Technical prime in major incidents affecting the network, accountable for identification of the underlying root cause, and all remediation activities; initiate Cisco TAC cases and work with TAC engineers to resolution

Responsible for capacity planning/management, performance monitoring, and network configuration management

Provide technical leadership in the adoption of new technologies and industry best practices

Support delivery of strategic roadmaps to evolve the enterprise network infrastructure portfolio, and provide subject matter expertise as roadmaps are planned and implemented

Maintain accurate design, hardware/software inventory, and operational documentation

Continuously improve delivery and quality of communications services through scripting and automation


To succeed in this role, you have


Formal Education and Certification



Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field (computer science, information systems management, engineering)

Industry certifications in one or more of the following (CCIE highly desired) Routing & Switching, Datacenter

Other certifications considered an asset Cisco Wireless, Palo Alto, ITIL




Skills, Knowledge And Experience




3+ years of experience as a senior engineer or comparable role, demonstrating technical design and implementation capabilities, focused on Cisco ACI, Cisco Routing & Switching, Azure & GCP in medium to large enterprise networks managing a multi cloud environment

Demonstrated in-depth knowledge F5 load balancers and Palo Alto firewalls

Expert knowledge in cloud native network components

Working knowledge in Direct connect to Azure, GCP and AWS

Experience with the preparation of technical design, implementation, system administration and operational documentation

Strong communication and Excellent documentation skills are required

Ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical executives and managers

Availability to troubleshoot and resolve issues during off-work hours and/or extended hours when outages or projects required

Development/Automation/Scripting knowledge (Terraform/Python)



Personal Attributes



Ability to work independently and effectively in a high-performing culture, be accountable to agreed deadlines, and manage multiple priorities

Well-developed project, organizational and time management skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present ideas to all levels in a clear and concise manner and deliver well-written, clear, and concise documentation

Ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external technical resources

 
Our story 


Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.


 Vaccination Policy 


At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Posted Today Full time JR-2698

Working with us is more than just a job – it is an opportunity to build a rewarding and fulfilling career. Our employees take great pride in serving the communities in which they live and contributing in a variety of ways to make important community-based initiatives possible globally.

industries: Telecommunications
description:
Engineer - Wireless Network 






Location: Regina or Saskatoon, Saskatchewan



Number of Positions:
 2


Position Types:
 Permanent Full-Time


Salary:
 $78,014 - $104,018 (Salary will be determined based on the candidate education and experience.)


Closing Date:
 March 21, 2022


Comments:
 Title of Engineer / Technology Solutions Manager will be determined based on qualifications of successful candidate. (See Qualification #1)





POSITION OVERVIEW


Accountable to develop & define the wireless business processes and strategy required to assure exceptional customer experience delivered by the wireless network for both existing and new service offerings. The focus of this position is to provide an overall view of the performance impacts of the introduction of new services, new network elements and new technologies to the existing wireless networks. Accountable to recommend exiting strategy technology migration or upgrade strategy and identify possible impacts to wireless networks and customer experience. Determine the business drivers and operational influences of all aspects of the architecture. This position will provide consultative expertise to senior management in the form of advice, recommendations, studies, written reports and presentations.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Accountable for the technical direction and consultation of network evolution and strategy as it pertains to network performance and ultimately customer experience.

Accountable for the development of tools, training and processes directed to improve the efficiency, effectiveness of managing and ensuring performance in the wireless network.

Accountable for identifying business drivers and maintaining business continuity through network evolution and performance.

Accountable to establish business process analysis, design and optimization supported by research and analysis that identify and resolve gaps in the wireless performance business process. All refinements, changes and evolution of business process are to align with Holdco strategic direction

Accountable to develop and execute a plan to operationalize the wireless performance process in support of exceptional customer experience

Work in conjunction with external and internal departments of TD&E providing performance development that benefits these business units. Where process crosses departmental boundaries, this position is responsible to engage the appropriate teams regarding any changes including the development and execution of transition plans to deliver future functionality.

Serve as a consultant to various business units and or any associated client areas, keeping them informed of any hardware/software strategies that are developing in the short term or long term that are directly related to a technology change or implementation to provide a new service or discontinue a legacy service or application.

Evaluate and create reports on the impacts of changing network elements, technologies, features, services or architecture. Provide information sessions to all departments and business units that would be directly affected by the service or technology requirements.

Develop and establish contacts and relationships with other telecommunication companies, consultants, vendors or other sources that may benefit wireless network performance and improve our customer experience.

Responsible for managing and maintaining a repository of information including; standards, architecture methodology, vendor documentation, technical requirements and project deliverables as it pertains to wireless performance.



QUALIFICATIONS



University Degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering or Electronic Information Systems Engineering OR Technical Institute diploma in Electronics Engineering Technology with three years related experience.

Working knowledge of consulting, research, change management, project management, continuous improvement, strategic/business planning would be a definite asset.

Knowledge and experience in various technologies including digital transmission/multiplex, data communications, switching, access technologies, frame and cell switching, LAN/WAN, Networking and transmission protocols and Network Management Knowledge and experience in operational support system and Information System Technology.

Ability to analyze business requirements and priorities and apply appropriate Information Technology solutions.

Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written, and the ability to deal effectively with others. Presentation skills are considered an essential asset.

Strong planning, analytical and research skills. Strong team member with the ability to influence others. Must demonstrate the ability to work autonomously without supervision.

Demonstrates a great deal of initiative and innovativeness

Demonstrates a commitment to self development and development of others.

Information Systems Professional (ISP) designation desirable.



ABOUT SASKTEL 


SaskTel is the leading Information and Communications Technology (ICT) provider in Saskatchewan, with over $1.2 billion in annual revenue and approximately 1.4 million customer connections including 617,000 wireless accesses, 374,500 wireline network accesses, 276,000 Internet accesses and 108,500 maxTV™ subscribers. SaskTel and its wholly-owned subsidiaries offer a wide range of ICT products and services including competitive voice, data and Internet services, wireless data services, maxTV services, data centre services, cloud-based services, security monitoring services, advertising services, and international software and consulting services. SaskTel and its wholly-owned subsidiaries have a workforce of approximately 4,000 full-time equivalent employees (FTEs). Visit SaskTel at www.sasktel.com.

 



We thank you for your interest and look forward to reviewing your application!

description:
The Senior Network Security Engineer
 performs two core functions for the enterprise. The first is the day-to-day operations of the in-place security solutions while the second is the identification, investigation and resolution of security breaches detected by those systems. Secondary tasks may include involvement in the implementation of new security solutions, participation in the creation and or maintenance of policies, standards, baselines, guidelines, and procedures as well as conducting vulnerability audits and assessments.




The Senior Network Security Engineer is expected to be fully aware of the enterprise’s security goals as established by its stated policies, procedures, and guidelines and to actively work towards up holding those goals.





The Ideal Candidate for this position will possess the following:



Formal Education & Certification:



College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science and/or 5 years equivalent work experience.

One or more of the following security certifications

CompTIA Security+

GIAC Information Security Fundamentals

Associate of (ISC)2






Knowledge & Experience:



Extensive hands-on technical knowledge of network systems, protocols, and standards such as Ethernet, LAN, WAN, MPLS, xDSL, TCP/IP, 802.11x, and so on

Strong knowledge of Palo Alto NGFW and Azure.

Strong knowledge of network management and analysis tools.

Extensive client/server and operating system experience.

Experience working in a switched and routed environment.

Hardware, software, and network connection troubleshooting experience.

Working technical knowledge of Cisco, Meraki, and Juniper network solutions.

Skilled at installing/configuring hubs, switches, routers, wireless access points, etc.

Good understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives.

Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.

description:
Meet Railz.





Railz is a FinTech company that provides a single API to all major accounting software (QuickBooks, Xero, Sage, etc.) service providers and enables on-demand access to financial transactions, analytics, insights and reports on small business customers.




Our solution suits any lender, financial institution, accounting firm, auditor and tech developer that requires financial data on its small business customers for the purpose of assessing the financial health of a business.




Our Data-as-a-Service solution allows our customers to be up and running in hours. We provide quick, low cost and direct access to both existing and new customers’ accounting software via our single API.




Who You Are:




You are an exceptionally talented software developer with the ability and desire to work on challenging projects that require you to constantly master new skills and technologies.




Working within the software development team, you will assist in the development and architecture of a variety of products including our Accounting Data as a Service API.





Responsibilities:






Write clean, efficient and scalable code

Use Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket to document and manage your work/code

Build on top of AWS infrastructure and interact with data stores such as MySQL and MongoDB

Ensure quality assurance over your codebase and the code of your peers

Contribute your knowledge and ideas to enhance the product and software development team

Adhere to an agile development process, adopt our CI/CD process, and attend periodic meetings to provide updates






Skills and Qualifications:






3+ years of production experience, with at least 2 working with Node.js, JavaScript / TypeScript and related frameworks (NestJS, Express)

Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms) and efficient design

Good understanding of API design and REST

Knowledge of relational (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.) and NoSQL (DynamoDB, MongoDB, etc.) databases

A high bar for code quality, craftsmanship, and attention to detail

Hands on experience with writing unit tests, and integration tests

Working knowledge of Agile (Scrum) Software Development Process methodologies

Strong organizational skills, excellent communication and self-motivation skills

Broad understanding of the design and architecture of modern web applications (containerization, automation CI/CD, etc.)

B.Sc. in Computer Science / Computer Engineering







Bonus Points:




Prior experience with SaaS products and startups

Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes containers

Experience in integrating payment and financial platforms (e.g. Stripe, QuickBooks, etc.)






Why Railz?


We work hard, and we have fun. Success is what motivates us everyday to be the best and keep winning in the market. We offer a variety of perks to ensure our team can always work hard and play hard:


Plenty of paid time off for vacation and personal days

Health Spending Account

Support for remote workers

Flexible work schedule

Competitive salary, benefits and equity incentives for everyone!

Hackathon events. For all who love to design and build.





This position is remote.

- You have 5+ years of experience developing, deploying and maintaining complex enterprise web applications (asset)

job_title: Network Development Engineer III - AWS Networking, Internet Edge Engineering
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


The AWS Networking organization is hiring, and we’re looking for talented Network Development Engineers (NDE) to join our team. Within Networking, we’re confronting and solving complex and high-stake challenges. Our teams support all aspects of connectivity to/from Amazon and the outside world, as well as the connectivity between Amazon’s data centers and services. As a member of one our network engineering teams, you will play a part in designing and architecting networks that simply cannot fail, must scale infinitely, and can never constrain growth or innovation.

This opportunity sits within our Internet Services organization where the team is responsible for designing the networks connecting Amazon directly to the outside world (including the Internet, peers, and external customers), evolving the global backbone that interconnects our Regions as well as partnering with our internal customers. Engineers in this organization define routing policy, design and implement Traffic Engineering solutions, as well as architect the hardware platforms and network design to support internal and external connectivity. We move terabits of traffic in and out of our networks each day and are responsible for the ingress and egress points of traffic entering and leaving Amazon as well as the entirety of all internal and customer traffic that rides our global backbone. Engineers on this team make day-to-day and strategic decisions that carry a huge amount of responsibility and impact.



Responsibilities



As a Network Development Engineer at Amazon, your core job responsibility is to design network topologies, architectures, and services that solve for many requirements. We listen to our customers (both internal and external), but we also listen to our teams. Our Engineers contribute materially to each team’s roadmap, and constantly help us to determine what’s most important. Together, you and your leadership team will decide on the projects that best support your team’s mission. You will have the resources and time necessary to understand, scope, and deliver these solutions. The primary area of responsibility you and your team will have is to design ahead of customer or technology needs, always predicting and solving for problems that have not yet occurred. This takes the form of creating and defending High Level Design (HLD) documents, working with vendors or internal stakeholders to influence technology roadmaps, constructing and testing your solutions, and providing support to the teams that will deploy and operate these designs. Our teams also serve as technical escalation points in support of our very talented operations teams.

Key job responsibilities

An Internet Edge NDE at AWS is responsible for providing our customers world class Internet connectivity by optimizing for security, availability, performance, and cost. We do this by setting network standards and creating scalable designs that our customers love.

A day in the life

We partner with customer and stakeholder teams, meeting with both to ensure we capture requirements and user experience stories to better equip ourselves with the tools we need to provide the highest performing network we can.



About The Team



We are based in Seattle, but have flexibility to support remote engineering throughout the west coast of North America.




Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor’s Degree in a technology related field or equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree

 8+ years professional experience working in large scale networking environments.

 5+ years of experience with internet routing protocols and concepts: TCP/IP, BGP, MPLS, ISIS and/or OSPF

 5+ years of experience with network operating systems such as Cisco IOS and Junos.

 5+ years of experience working in a Linux/Unix environment

 5+ years of experience in automation via Bash/shell scripting and Perl/Python programming.




Preferred Qualifications




 Knowledge of network analysis fundamentals and robust troubleshooting skills; specifically, network performance analysis

 Experience working with customers to diagnose a problem, and work toward resolution

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role

 Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Data Services CAN, Inc.

Job Summary



At Maxis, we're looking for a software engineer to work on cloud web services to help us bring exciting new features to life. You will work with an experienced team that has collectively built Maxis games for more than two decades. You will work with multiple designers, producers, and client engineers prototyping and shipping features that expand the gameplay possibilities of The Sims. You will report to a Development Director for the backend services team and the bulk of your work will be done in Java and Kotlin, using the Spring Boot framework, deployed to Kubernetes in the Google Cloud Platform.


 As a Backend Software Engineer at Maxis, you will 



 Develop responsive, resilient, massively scalable, and globally available web services that support millions of Sims players 

 Creatively blend security best practices and original techniques to keep user data secure and prevent cheating 

 Apply and improve service deployment and troubleshooting strategies that maximize uptime 

 Drive design and implementation of APIs and protocols that are consistent, formalized, and testable 

 Demonstrate excellent technical problem-solving skills under iteratively changing requirements during game development 

 Author and review technical design documents and API specifications detailing software requirements

 Participate in 24-hour support of live environments 

 Participate in the upkeep and maintenance of live services 




Qualifications



Please note that you do not need to qualify for all requirements to be considered. We encourage you to apply if you can meet most of the requirements and are comfortable opening a dialog to be considered


 Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field. 

 3+ years of job experience in a hands on coding role 

 You've shipped and supported scalable web services hosted in the cloud 

 You own large systems and features from design to deployment, including live service support 

 You develop high-quality, testable software 

 You have a desire to work with client engineers and designers to iteratively add features and improve APIs 

 You develop APIs for products that release new updates with zero downtime strategies and tools 

 You have experience with load testing, troubleshooting, and optimizing performance of web services 

 You work on software that requires developing and optimizing queries and database access patterns 

 You're willing to iterate quickly and develop multiple short-lived prototypes 

 You have excellent written and verbal communication skills 

 You're a motivated self-starter; able to operate with autonomy 

 You have a desire to teach and learn from your peers 



 Pluses 



 You have experience developing services that support mobile applications 

 You've worked in the games industry before 

 You've built software with Java or Kotlin 

 You've shipped services using the Spring Boot Framework 

 You've worked on large teams using version control tools like Git 

 You've deployed web services using Kubernetes and containerization 

 You have experience with Google Cloud Platform, including Google Kubernetes Engine, or Google Cloud Spanner 

 You have experience with distributed streaming technologies like Kafka 

 You've shipped web services that scale to millions of daily users 

 You have experience working in large data-driven services

job_title: Indoor Connectivity Solutions Engineer | Ingénieur(e) en solutions de connectivité d'intérieur
industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Meta Connectivity is constantly iterating to solve problems, co-develop solutions and deploy networks through direct engagement with the global telecoms industry, including network operators, network equipment vendors and communities such as the Telecom Infra Project (TIP). We are looking for a practical, system thinker and technical expert who respectfully questions the status quo to discover and implement high impact solutions. If you have passion for networks and want to work with network operators, industry partners, and internal teams to drive innovative, cost efficient solutions that accelerate the scaled deployment of a faster internet – then this is a great role for you.As an Indoor Wi-Fi Solutions Engineer, you will engage with Meta Connectivity engineering and product teammates as well as TIP OpenWiFi community members to design, develop, trial and deploy Wi-Fi solutions. In parallel, you will interface with industry leading partners including hardware/software vendors and system solution providers. Finally, you will work closely with network operators technical teams to understand how Meta and its partner’s contributions can be of most impact for indoor connectivity.-------Meta Connectivity fait sans cesse des itérations pour résoudre des problèmes, codévelopper des solutions et déployer des réseaux en collaboration directe avec l'industrie mondiale des télécommunications, y compris les opérateurs de réseaux, les vendeurs d'équipement et des communautés telles que Telecom Infra Project (TIP). Nous recherchons une personne à l'esprit pratique et à la pensée systémique, qui questionne le statu quo avec respect afin de découvrir et mettre en pratique des solutions à grande portée. Si vous êtes passionné(e) pour les réseaux et que vous voulez travailler avec des opérateurs de réseaux, des partenaires de l'industrie et des équipes à l'interne pour produire des solutions novatrices, rentables et efficaces qui permettront d'accélerer le déploiement à grande échelle d'un réseau internet plus rapide, alors ceci est un rôle parfait pour vous.En tant qu'ingénieur(e) wifi d'intérieur, vous collaborerez avec vos équipiers à l'ingénierie et aux produits chez Meta Connectivity ainsi qu'avec des membres de la communauté TIP OpenWiFi pour concevoir, développer, mettre à l'essai et déployer des solutions wifi. Parallèlement, vous communiquerez avec des partenaires éminents au sein de l'industrie, dont des vendeurs de produits matériels/logiciels et des fournisseurs de solutions système. Finalement, vous travaillerez de près avec les équipes techniques d'opérateurs de réseaux pour comprendre comment les contributions de Meta et de ses partenaires peuvent produire le plus grand impact pour la connectivité d'intérieur.

Indoor Connectivity Solutions Engineer | Ingénieur(e) en solutions de connectivité d'intérieur Responsibilities:



Develop use cases & requirements, architect, design, develop, and test solutions working closely with network operators, SaaS cloud providers, ODM hardware providers, application vendors (ISVs), system integrators (SIs), as well as internal engineering, product, and cross-functional teams. | Développer des cas d'utilisation et des exigences, faire l'architecture, la conception, le développement et le test de solutions en collaboration étroite avec des opérateurs de réseaux, des fournisseurs infonuagiques SaaS, des fournisseurs de matériel ODM, des éditeurs de logiciels indépendants (ELI), des intégrateurs de systèmes (IS), ainsi qu'avec des équipes d'ingénierie, de produits et multi-disciplinaires à l'interne.

Support the Community Development of Open Indoor Systems that enable network operators to quickly adopt innovative, lowest total cost of ownership approaches for indoor connectivity. | Soutenir le Développement communautaire de systèmes d'intérieur ouverts, qui permet aux opérateurs de réseaux d'adopter rapidement des approches novatrices et à faible coût pour la connectivité d'intérieur.

Work closely with and support network operators and infrastructure providers to plan and execute deployment projects from lab/field/market trials to scale deployments. | Travailler de près et soutenir les opérateurs de réseaux et les fournisseurs d'infrastructure pour la planification et l'exécution de projets de déploiment, depuis les essais en labo/sur le terrain/sur le marché jusqu'au déploiment à grande échelle.

Strong communication, interpersonal, and collaboration experience with both external partners (technical & non-technical) and internal cross-functional teams. | Solide expérience en communication, en relations interpersonnelles et en collaboration, autant avec des partenaires à l'externe (techniques et non techniques) qu'avec des équipes multi-disciplinaires à l'interne.

Willingness to work within partner - vendor facilities, able to travel up to 10% time, and/or cross-time zone calls. | Volonté de travailler sur des sites appartenant à des partenaires/vendeurs, capacité à voyager jusqu'à 10 % du temps et/ou à effectuer des appels hors de son fuseau horaire.



Minimum Qualifications:



Experience working across technical domains and organizations to identify, describe and define end-to-end solutions and approaches | Expérience de travail multidisciplinaire et avec plusieurs organisations pour identifier, décrire et définir des solutions et des approches intégrées.

Experience with network centric software architecture, data model, and API design & implementation | Expérience avec l'architecture logicielle, la modélisation de données et la conception d'API réseaucentriques.

Experience with Linux Foundation (LF) Networking/network operating systems | Expérience avec les systèmes d'exploitation et de réseautage de la Fondation Linux (FL).

Experience in one or more scripting languages such as Python, Bash, etc., and debugging scripting issues | Expérience avec un ou plusieurs langages de script, tels que Python, Bash, etc., ainsi qu'avec le débogage de problèmes de scriptage.

Experience with micro-services architectures for network management and automation systems | De l'expérience dans le domaine des architectures micro-services pour les systèmes de gestion et d'automatisation des réseaux.

Knowledge of core network, Access Network design and Edge Computing/Function Virtualization | Connaissance du réseau central, de la conception du réseau d'accès et de l'informatique de périphérie/de la virtualisation des fonctions.

Experience with operator back office OSS systems including Inventory, Assurance and Service Activation | De l'expérience dans les systèmes OSS de service d'appui des opérateurs, notamment l'inventaire, l'assurance et l'activation des services.

Experience with release engineering, CI/CD tools, DevOps tools (Ansible, Jenkins, Docker, etc.), and automated testing of network software | Expérience avec l'ingénierie de mise en production, les outils CI/CD, les outils DevOps (Ansible, Jenkins, Docker, etc.) et le test de logiciels réseau automatisé.

Firm understanding of mobile and in-building wireless network infrastructure and architectures | Connaissance approfondie de l'infrastructure et des architectures des réseaux sans fil mobiles et internes aux bâtiments.

Familiarity with the evolution and recent development of cellular and Wi-Fi wireless networking | Familiarité avec l'évolution et le développement récent des réseaux sans fil cellulaires et Wi-Fi

Experience with Wi-Fi back office systems including captive portals, network assist, authentication and redirection | Expérience avec les systèmes wifi administratifs, incluant les portails captifs, l'aide au réseautage, l'authentification et la redirection

Experience understanding and describing network management and automation solutions for multiple deployment and operations scenarios including in-building/outdoor uses cases, fixed/mobile access, enterprise/public access | De l'expérience dans la compréhension et la description des solutions de gestion et d'automatisation des réseaux pour de multiples scénarios de déploiement et d'exploitation, y compris les cas d'utilisation à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur des bâtiments, l'accès fixe/mobile, l'accès aux entreprises et au public.

Communication skills including experience talking to both technical and business audiences. Knowledge to collaborate with both external partners and internal cross-functional teams | Habiletés en communication, incluant de l'expérience avec des auditoires provenant des milieux techniques et des affaires. Connaissances permettant de collaborer avec des partenaires externes ainsi qu'avec des équipes multidisciplinaires à l'interne.

Understanding of business-related aspects of a solution, and proven to interact with business teams on technical & economic aspects of a solution | Compréhension des aspects commerciaux d'une solution, et preuve d'expérience en interaction avec des équipes en milieu d'affaires sur les aspects techniques et économiques d'une solution.

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta. | Possède, ou est en train d'obtenir une licence en informatique, en génie informatique, dans un domaine technique pertinent, ou une expérience pratique équivalente. Le diplôme doit être obtenu avant de rejoindre Meta.
