industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer Games
description:
Backend Software Engineer III (Temporary - 1 year) 


Location: Remote open to most locations in North America



Job Summary



At Maxis, we're looking for a software engineer to work on cloud web services to help us bring exciting new features to life. You will work with an experienced team that has collectively built Maxis games for more than two decades. You will work with multiple designers, producers, and client engineers prototyping and shipping features that expand the gameplay possibilities of The Sims. You will report to a Development Director for the backend services team and the bulk of your work will be done in Java and Kotlin, using the Spring Boot framework, deployed to Kubernetes in the Google Cloud Platform.


 As a Backend Software Engineer at Maxis, you will 



 Develop responsive, resilient, massively scalable, and globally available web services that support millions of Sims players 

 Creatively blend security best practices and original techniques to keep user data secure and prevent cheating 

 Apply and improve service deployment and troubleshooting strategies that maximize uptime 

 Drive design and implementation of APIs and protocols that are consistent, formalized, and testable 

 Demonstrate excellent technical problem-solving skills under iteratively changing requirements during game development 

 Author and review technical design documents and API specifications detailing software requirements 

 Maintain a suite of automated tests that validate the correctness of backend services 

 Participate in 24-hour support of live environments 

 Participate in the upkeep and maintenance of live services 




Qualifications



Please note that you do not need to qualify for all requirements to be considered. We encourage you to apply if you can meet most of the requirements and are comfortable opening a dialog to be considered


 Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field. 

 3+ years of job experience in a hands on coding role 

 You've shipped and supported scalable web services hosted in the cloud 

 You own large systems and features from design to deployment, including live service support 

 You develop high-quality, testable software 

 You have a desire to work with client engineers and designers to iteratively add features and improve APIs 

 You develop APIs for products that release new updates with zero downtime strategies and tools 

 You have experience with load testing, troubleshooting, and optimizing performance of web services 

 You work on software that requires developing and optimizing queries and database access patterns 

 You're willing to iterate quickly and develop multiple short-lived prototypes 

 You have excellent written and verbal communication skills 

 You're a motivated self-starter; able to operate with autonomy 

 You have a desire to teach and learn from your peers 



 Pluses 



 You have experience developing services that support mobile applications 

 You've worked in the games industry before 

 You've built software with Java or Kotlin 

 You've shipped services using the Spring Boot Framework 

 You've worked on large teams using version control tools like Git 

 You've deployed web services using Kubernetes and containerization 

 You have experience with Google Cloud Platform, including Google Kubernetes Engine, or Google Cloud Spanner 

 You have experience with distributed streaming technologies like Kafka 

 You've shipped web services that scale to millions of daily users 

 You have experience working in large data-driven services

industries: Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
Position Summary



At Samsung Electronics Canada, we take pride in the creativity and diversity of our talented people – they are at the forefront of everything we do. Their skillset and mindset drive our continued success. We want the best of the best at Samsung to join our team, not just those who fit into our Culture but those who will ADD to our Culture and make Samsung an even better place to work.

Did we catch your attention yet?

If you want to work for one of the most recognized brands in the world and one of the Top 100 Employers in Canada...and have a ton of fun…. then please keep reading!



Our Perks




 Flexible Remote Working Environment

 Competitive Salary and Performance based incentive plan for all levels

 Employer paid Medical and Dental coverage from day one

 Group RRSP plan that helps you save for the future

 Fantastic employee discount on all Samsung products

 Tuition Reimbursement to keep you learning

 Employee Referral program- we want great talent like you!


The role of the Deployment and Support Engineer is to support our carrier customers with innovative technology and market-leading products and solutions in areas like 4G/5G Core, IP Multimedia Sub-System (IMS).



Role And Responsibilities





Essential Duties and Responsibilities: 




Execution of on-site & remote deployments of 4G/5G Core & IMS Network elements

Build & setup necessary infrastructure environment to carry out System test for 4G/5G Core & IMS Network elements

Define functional specification & prepare High Level Design documents.

Prepare and deliver MOPs & troubleshooting guide for our customers

Supporting integration, configuration & testing of 4G & IMS network elements.

Co-accountable for functional & non-functional testing of deployed systems.

Involve in troubleshooting, software updates and network change requests.

Involve in preparing & executing Acceptance Test Case.

Co-accountable for operational launch of solution.

Develop/modify test scripts to enable automation of System deployments, System Integration & verification activities.




Requirements/Knowledge




Knowledge of wireless telecommunications networks (4G, 5G, IMS)

Experience with Virtualization, Containerized / Cloud-Native environments (MicroService infrastructures, OpenShift, OpenStack)

Working experience with cloud providers – Google, AWS, Azure

Experience on SIP, DIAMETER, HTTP/HTTPS, SOAP, RTP/SRTP

Experience in System Integration, designing, deploying and testing in a multi-Vendor platform scenario.

Proven experience working with distributed Linux operating systems (installation, configuration and troubleshooting).

Understanding of Linux core fundamentals, scripting and service monitoring.

Solid understanding of IP networking (CCNA, CCNP etc…).

Good scripting skills (awk, sed, bash).

Firm understanding of version control systems such as subversion.

Solid understanding of Lean, Agile, CICD, SRE, DevOps methodologies

Have exceptional troubleshooting and customer-handling skills.

Excellent communication skills (verbal and written).

Business travel may be required as per business needs.




Education




Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science / Engineering or related field

Master’s Degree in Computer Science, System’s Design Engineering or related field considered an asset. 




Experience




1-3 years of relevant experience.

Previous experience in deploying applications on virtualized or containerized environments.

Experience with scripting, development, creating a CICD pipeline.

Ability to think outside of the box and develop new ways of solving business problems using automation and continuous delivery.

Explore, evaluate and adopt technologies so as to add value in the deployment process and/or the platform to be delivered.

Taking ownership of technical issues, and working with our Development group to resolve issues

Resolving escalated customer complaints.

Documenting troubleshooting and problem resolution steps.



 Samsung is an equal employment opportunity employer. 



 Samsung has an accommodation process in place and provides accommodations for job applicants with disabilities as appropriate. Assessment and selection materials and procedures can be made available in accessible formats and methods as appropriate. If you require a specific accommodation because of disability or medical need, please let us know when selected to take part in our recruitment process so that reasonable arrangements can be made for the appropriate accommodations to be in place as you move through our process. 



 We thank you for your interest in working for Samsung. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. 



 #indhigh 




Skills And Qualifications




 Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here .

industries: Armed Forces
description:
The Graduate Systems Engineer will play a role in a multi-disciplinary project team developing new and innovative solutions for the Royal Canadian Navy and its partners in the Anti-Submarine Warfare (ASW) domain.

The Graduate Systems Engineer will work with the Systems Team to analyze system concepts; define requirements; create and document the system design and interfaces; define and manage subsystem requirements; and verify / validate the system to ensure it fulfils the Customer's requirements and needs.



Work Within a Multi-disciplinary Team To




 Contribute to defining and describing the Technical Solution during bids Define and manage system and subsystem requirements

 Conduct trade studies to evaluate different potential design solutions

 Contributing to the System Design, through functional and non-functional analysis

 Support the definition of the Integration, Verification and Validation strategy and manage this through the program

 Participate in technical / design reviews

 Support the continuous improvement of the Systems Engineering function, including processes and tools

 Other tasks as assigned




Required Qualifications




 Bachelor's Engineering Degree in Electrical, Math, Physics, Computer Science or equivalent experience

 Engineering Coop Experience




Desired Skills




 Familiarity with the Maritime Domain (desirable)

 Familiarity with Underwater Warfare or Acoustics (desirable)

 Familiarity with Systems Engineering Processes and lifecycle.

 Familiarity with Requirements Definition and Requirements Management

 Aware of System Design approaches and techniques

 Aware of Algorithm Definition and Validation through use of tools like Matlab

 Aware of Integration, Verification and Validation activities, including Test Planning, Test Conduct and Reporting

 Knowledge of System Engineering lifecycles

 Able to work within an interdisciplinary team and understand the perspectives of other disciplines

 Able to conduct trade studies to evaluate different potential solutions

 Able to contribute to the System Design, through functional and non-functional analysis

 A team-oriented individual that works collaboratively to achieve team goals

 Strong communication skills; positive attitude

 Must be self-motivated, adaptable, and attentive to details

 Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a deadline-oriented environment


Specific Role Requirement


 Ability to work on Canadian Controlled Goods and US ITAR controlled articles

 Candidate must be capable of acquiring a NATO Reliability and Secret security clearance

 Occasional travel within Canada, US and Overseas


#MAR

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. A review of this classification has excluded the marginal functions of the classification that are incidental to the performance of fundamental job duties. All duties and responsibilities are essential job functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities to perform this job proficiently. The requirements in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, or abilities.

What's in it for you?

We offer a competitive benefits package including extended health and dental, life insurance, RRSP, deferred profit sharing, optional critical illness insurance, an EFAP and student bursaries.

We encourage regular manager-employee performance feedback, goal alignment and employee development through our Employee Performance Development Plan (EPDP)

We are an Equal Opportunities employer and particularly welcome applications from Women, Aboriginal Persons, Persons with Disabilities and Visible Minorities.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer Games
description:
Empowering players to create is an exciting future for the gaming industry. At Electronic Arts we have many examples of players creating content, whether it be a skateboard park in Skate or fantastical mansions in the Sims 4. The future definitely has our players being more empowered to create with their imagination being the only limit.

To allow more players to become creators, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to shape the technology that powers creation. If you have experience with building services for user generated content through modern techniques connecting multiple services together we want to hear from you.

You will work with an experienced team that has collectively built and worked on games and backend services for more than two decades. You will work with multiple developers to bring the next game services to life.

We aim to improve in our development approaches and with our services. Many of our software engineers are "polyglots" and strive in multiple environments.



Responsibilities




Work in partnership with game teams to design shared services

Develop and launch high-traffic services for multi-platform AAA titles

Perform service load testing to resolve bottlenecks

Work with the engineering and DevOps teams on best practices

Research and integrate new technologies

Oversee the health, quality, maintainability and style of the server codebase




Qualifications




6+ years of technology industry experience

BS in Computer Science or other relevant experience

Experience with client/server architecture

Knowledge of HTTP and how to design and work with RESTful web services

Expert ability to analyze and interpret technical data

Experience with throughput, latency, memory and CPU use

Development experience with either Kotlin, Java, Go, and Node.js

Experience with source code management (Perforce, Git)

Public Cloud providers (AWS, GCE, Azure)

Understand containers, orchestrators and service mesh technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Envoy, Istio, Linkerd, and Jaeger)

Understanding of different database and their performance characteristics (SQL and NoSQL)

Experience working with CI/CD technologies

Passion to investigate and adopt new technologies and practices


Bonus Skills


Experience shipping AAA games

Experience working with PlayStation and Xbox online systems

Experience with or exposure to micro-services

Experience with or with cloud native application development

Knowledge of gRPC, Protocol buffers and FlatBuffers

Le Renard
 est une petite entreprise de service-conseil spécialisée en développement logiciel. Nous sommes experts dans l'optimisation de logiciels de gestion d’entreprise, la personnalisation d'ERP et la transformation numérique pour des entreprises québécoises dans le secteur industriel, manufacturier et de la construction.




Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un 

développeur
 
pour se joindre à notre équipe de programmation.





En rejoignant l’équipe de Le Renard, vous serez responsable de:



Développer et programmer des évolutions sur les logiciels de nos clients (Applications client/serveur, applications web, applications mobiles) selon les user stories et tickets élaborés par le Product Owner;

Développer de nouveaux logiciels et modules à partir de zéro

Créer de rapports et de formulaires provenant de différentes bases de données.

Analyser et élaborer la conception technique du code et des structures de données;

Contribuer aux estimations de temps des « user stories »;

Préparer la planification technique et conceptuelle avant de commencer la programmation;

Concevoir, programmer, exécuter les scénarios de test

Participer au UX et UI au besoin;

Fournir un support fonctionnel aux clients au besoin;

Maintenir à jour la traçabilité/documentation des tâches effectuées et du temps attribué pour chacun des projets en cours;

Participer au partage de connaissance et à l’amélioration continue de l’équipe;






Pourquoi postuler chez Le Renard?



Projets variés et stimulants au sein de plusieurs entreprises québécoises.

Possibilité de télé-travail à 100% (possibilité de travailler au bureau selon votre préférence)

Horaire de travail flexible et équilibre travail-vie personnelle

Banque de congés de maladies transformable en vacances si non-utilisé durant l’année

Semaine de travail flexible entre 35 et 40 heures

Temps consacré à la formation et au développement des connaissance mensuellement

Activités d'équipe trimestrielles

Assurances collectives « à la carte » avec contribution de l’employeur (possibilité d’y ajouter les assurances dentaires selon vos besoins)

Programme d’aide aux employés (Ligne 24/7 à des questions légales, financières, psychologiques)

Programme de reconnaissance de l’ancienneté

Programme de référencement






Ce que nous recherchons:



Baccalauréat en informatique/programmation logiciel/TI ou combinaison DEC + années d’expérience jugée pertinente au poste;

2 ans d’expérience en développement logiciel;

Expérience en C# (Framework .Net et .Net Core) et/ou Java

Expérience en SQL

Intérêt en expérience usager et UI

Un « Fit » avec nos valeurs d’entreprises :

Quelqu’un qui sait s’adapter

Quelqu’un qui est professionnel

Quelqu’un qui vise toujours plus haut

Quelqu’un qui croit que tout le monde est important

Quelqu’un d’audacieux et créatif





*Veuillez prendre note que le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte et ce sans préjudice pour la forme féminine. Bienvenue à tous!




Pour en apprendre plus sur l'entreprise visitez notre site web : renardsolutions.ca

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Job Description



Network Analyst



Note



Strong Operations experience - 3 years (troubleshooting), ticketing

Work Location: Onsite from SOC (no work from home) - Scarborough location

Rotating 12-hour shift schedule i.e., 2 shifts (7am-7pm ET) & (7pm-7am ET). Candidates must be available to do both shifts according to their rotation/shift schedule.




Summary Of Day-To-Day Responsibilities:



Our client is purely Network Ops Level 1/1.5 team, and we deal with less complex to semi-complex issues and look into complex issues and try to resolve them.

This is Tier 1 level support role

Operations Support Group (Network Operations) is a 7/24 Service Availability (Dual Site Coverage) department responsible for providing frontline support of Clients' network environment.

The primary focus of the team is reacting to any/all anomalies that are presented through a variety of monitoring tools for the Bank’s mission-critical network.

We are looking for self-motivated and focused individuals who enjoy a fast-paced environment requiring attention to detail.




Job Requirements



The successful candidate must possess the following:

Strong team player, self-motivated, highly organized, and able to multi-task in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are essential to interact with support groups, clients, and vendors.

Experience and a sound understanding of network environments (TCP/IP, Cisco routers/switches, Firewall, Load Balancers, Wi-Fi) including an excellent understanding of telecommunications concepts and connectivity.

Strong understanding of Switching and Routing - Cisco Catalyst Switches: 2950, 2960, 9200, 3750, 3850, 4500 series, 6500 series, Cisco Nexus 2k/5k/7k/9k

Hands-on experience with Palo Alto Firewalls, F5 Load balancers, Aruba or Cisco Wi-Fi, Cisco Viptela SDWAN, Cisco ACI, VMware NSX is a definite asset for this position.

Proficient in executing diagnostic techniques with a sound foundation of monitoring tools which include Tivoli ITNM, Vitalnet, QIP, Netscout, and Riverbed.

Virtualization, Cloud Computing, Network Security, VMware, AWS

Sound second-level problem determination and problem source identification skills with regards to the various network technologies utilized within the client globally.




Specific Educational Requirements / Accreditations



Technology Degree/Diploma or equivalent work experience.

Must have Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification coupled with 5 years of experience

Palo Alto Network Certified Network Security Engineer (PCNSE) and certification in MS Azure are a definite plus




Must Haves:



CCNP (R&S) Cert (CCNP certified with minimum 3 years of troubleshooting experience OR CCNA certified with min 5 years of troubleshooting experience)

Routing and switching

Troubleshooting experience/Break fixes




Nice to have:



CCNP (SDWAN) Cert

Hands-on experience with:

Cisco Viptela SDWAN

Cisco ACI

Palo Alto firewalls

F5 load balancers

VMware NSX




Degree/Certifications Required:



CCNP OR CCNA certification is a must-have

job_title: SW - System Software Quality Engineer (Toronto OR Remote)
industries: Software Development, Wireless Services, and Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
Company



Qualcomm Canada ULC



Job Area



Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Test Engineering



General Summary



As a System Software Quality Engineer, you are responsible for working with a team to verify the production worthiness of a complete system stack of Qualcomm hardware and software. You will collaborate with hardware designers, software/firmware developers, platform engineering teams and post-silicon verification teams. In this role, there will also be an opportunity to engage with our customers and third parties on the drive for a quality product release.



Role And Responsibilities




Design, develop, execute and maintain software tools and automated test suites for the purpose of verifying quality and compliance of Qualcomm products at the system level

Manually test, where appropriate, the customer experience of installation and deployment of Qualcomm hardware and software in a data center environment

Assist in the creation of a Quality Engineering/Release engineering process with emphasis on continuous integration and continuous development

Assist in the definition of future server class SoCs and platforms by identifying opportunities for enhancement of Qualcomm products

Assist in identifying skills requirements and building a team of engineers working on production software readiness, customer use-cases, workload analysis, workload creation, and collaborating with other teams on bring-up/debug/diags

Focus on ensuring that existing Operating Systems and customer usage environments run well, while identifying strong opportunity for enhancements





Preferred Qualifications




5 years+ of demonstrated software test engineering experience

Strong understanding and experience in data center environments and related test automation techniques

Strong Linux programming skills with experience in C/C++ and build systems

Experience in working with Linux Open Source projects and toolchains

Experience developing software for server platforms and platform bringup

Experience testing for production quality software, on schedule, particularly in an organization that delivers software to enable silicon hardware

Additional Asset qualification: Experience in release engineering, continuous integration and continuous development environments





Physical Requirements




Frequently transports between offices, buildings and campuses up to ½ mile.

Frequently transports and install equipment up to 5 lbs.

Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g. standing or sitting).

Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day.

Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers and vendors both in person and remotely.





Education




Minimum Qualifications


Bachelors - Computer Science, Bachelors - Engineering, Bachelors - Information Systems



Work Experiences



1+ years experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security
description:
A10 Networks seeks a Systems Engineer to partner with our Regional Sales Director in a pre-sales and post-sales technical role, showcasing A10 Networks' product solutions-setting up demonstrations and explaining features and benefits to customers - and designing and configuring products to meet specific customer needs. In additional to technological aptitude, and the ability to learn quickly and stay current, the ideal candidate's interpersonal, presentation and troubleshooting skills evoke passion and confidence.


 Your day-to-day 



Develop and execute a plan that accelerates A10 Networks technology adoption

Drive the pre-sales cycle from pitch to demonstration to successful evaluation

Provide technical pre-sales support for sales teams

Assist develop and implement specific account penetration strategies

Design complex solutions and be a part of the building of quotations for customer sales presentations

Provide guidance/assistance in deployments, technical training, and industry seminars and/or trade shows

Develop relationships with the sales teams, partners and customers in support of A10 Networks sales objectives

Provide technical expertise and real-life experience in creating solutions, designs, proof of concept and implementation

Conduct research and use knowledge of competitive solutions to effectively address and dispel customer objections

Educate customers and partners on the A10 Networks product solutions

Drive high levels of customer and partner satisfaction

Compile and update and track changes to tools and how-to guides




Position Requirements




8+ years industry experience in sales engineering

Must have a good understanding of the sales process and the roles and responsibilities of a sales engineer

4+ years of Layer 4-7 switching experience and expertise

Strong knowledge of Layer 2-3 switching/routing

You have been a part of a sales team before or you want your career to go that direction

Strong technical presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written

Must be able to thrive in a fast paced, high energy environment

Ability to work independently, adapt quickly, and maintain a positive attitude

BS/BA (EE/CS) or equivalent

CISSP or other security certifications are a plus!

Ability to travel when required 

Position requires a min of 50% travel. 

Experience in working in a remote office

 Experience selling enterprise-level technical solutions to Federal Government clients 

 Eligible to hold a DoD security clearance with preference of holding a Top Secret SCI clearance

description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, IgniteTech. Have you got what it takes?

Are you an experienced C/C++ developer in your company? Do you enjoy working on complex B2B applications, yet manage to simplify your codes by utilizing cutting-edge technologies? If so, we invite you to join our unique team of top-notch talent. In this role, you will be taking ownership of the big feature releases, starting with getting requirements from the stakeholders to releasing the end product to customers in a fast-paced agile environment besides maintaining mission-critical enterprise applications. If you are passionate about leading the path to creating the greatest products with the best cloud technologies in our industry, we would love to hear from you.

At IgniteTech, we are reinventing the enterprise software industry. Our “Netflix for Enterprise Software” model is changing the game for how enterprises buy software, and a key element of our growth strategy is to drive great customer experiences across our broad and growing library of solutions.



What You Will Be Doing




Development/customizations of a large set of applications from our broad portfolio of B2B products

Upgrade quality of work produced by your subordinates by showing them, how to make it in better quality

Improve efficiency through introducing automation & new tools




What You Won’t Be Doing




Managing people or getting stuck on long meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities

Stagnating on the same technology. You will be continuously expanding your knowledge and experience with new products. HR and recruitment




Technical Support Engineer Key Responsibilities




Designing and implementing new product features in the most efficient, effective, and maintainable way

Becoming the go-to expert on products to which you are assigned.

Learning new products quickly and effectively when given access to user and developer documentation, knowledge base articles, source code, and infrastructure.

Understand and interpret customer requests to suggest the best solution available and take responsibility for implementing the solution.

Resolving complex technical issues

Effort Estimation




Basic Requirements




A degree in computer science or equivalent.

5+ years of development experience in multiple software languages.

3+ years of C#/ASP.net coding experience

C1 level English proficiency and the ability to write with a professional tone.




Nice-to-have Requirements




Experience working with C/C++, Java, or Python

Hands-on cloud development experience.

Experience in building and delivering enterprise-grade SaaS products.

Experience with leading a team.




About IgniteTech



If you want to work hard at a company where you can grow and be a part of a dynamic team, join IgniteTech!

Through our portfolio of leading enterprise software solutions, we ignite business performance for thousands of customers globally. We’re doing it in an entirely remote workplace that is focused on building teams of top talent and operating in a model that provides challenging opportunities and personal flexibility.

A career with IgniteTech is challenging and fast-paced. We are always looking for energetic and enthusiastic employees to join our world-class team.

We offer opportunities for personal contribution and promote career development. IgniteTech is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!


Working with Crossover


This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.


What to expect next:



You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.

Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.



Important!
 If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.

Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

industries: Software Development
description:
Do What You Love. Love What You Do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.


About The Team


Join our Student Product team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.


About The Role



About the Role


Do you want to transform the student experience? We’re looking for talented software engineers to design and build Workday's newest SaaS offering - Workday Student. You will join a dynamic team of developers that is reimagining the student experience including everything from registering for classes to financial aid. Starting with a clean sheet of paper, we are transforming the way that colleges enable their students for success. Our solutions are built using the most modern technologies, providing an unparalleled level of agility, ease-of-use, and integration capability - all in the cloud.


About The Team


Workday Student is expanding its team to Vancouver, BC! This is an amazing leadership opportunity to recruit and build a team from the ground up. The team will be focused on accelerating the delivery of new features in an agile environment for our Workday Student product. This is a highly visible and crucial position that will involve working with development leadership and product management to impact delivery milestones for a core part of the Student application. In addition, there will be opportunities to work with Workday Student’s largest Canadian customers to ensure that we are meeting the needs of Canadian colleges and universities.


About You


Basic Qualifications


Must be a collaborative team player with good communication skills.

BS+5 or MS+3 years of experience with UML, Web application development or SaaS (Software as a Service) technologies

OO design and Java development experience




Other Qualifications



Experience with XML and Integration technologies is a plus.

Metadata-driven definitional development experience is a plus.

Experience designing/developing business applications – functional knowledge of Student Information Systems is a plus.

Knowledge of Test Driven Development practices

4 year degree in a computer related field or equivalent in-progress




About The Product


Workday is the only software for higher education designed to stay current with your institution’s changing needs. Click here to learn more!

This video provides an overview of Workday Student, which allows students, faculty members, and staff to perform tasks on any device, anytime, and anywhere. With Workday Student, institutions can provide endless engagement and in-the-moment notifications to ensure informed academic decisions


About Workday Vancouver:


Workday Vancouver is located in the heart of the downtown financial district and is walking distance to public transportation, residences, Coal Harbour and more! The location is home to many of Workday's new up and coming development and emerging technology teams. This means you will have the opportunity to not only be part of the Workday Student team, but also collaborate and interact with some of Workday's outstanding innovation teams. Workday has recently been named as one of the Great Places to work in Canada and the culture in this office extends through to the core values of the company, encouraging a fun and diverse environment. Come be part of this dynamic and growing organization!


Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

description:
Network Analyst



Note






Strong Operations experience - 3 years (troubleshooting), ticketing





Work Location: Onsite from SOC (no work from home) - Scarborough location





Rotating 12-hour shift schedule i.e., 2 shifts (7am-7pm ET) & (7pm-7am ET). Candidates must be available to do both shifts according to their rotation/shift schedule.





  

Summary Of Day-To-Day Responsibilities:






Our client is purely Network Ops Level 1/1.5 team, and we deal with less complex to semi-complex issues and look into complex issues and try to resolve them.





This is Tier 1 level support role





Operations Support Group (Network Operations) is a 7/24 Service Availability (Dual Site Coverage) department responsible for providing frontline support of Clients' network environment.





The primary focus of the team is reacting to any/all anomalies that are presented through a variety of monitoring tools for the Bank’s mission-critical network.





We are looking for self-motivated and focused individuals who enjoy a fast-paced environment requiring attention to detail.





  

Job Requirements






The successful candidate must possess the following:





Strong team player, self-motivated, highly organized, and able to multi-task in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.





Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are essential to interact with support groups, clients, and vendors.





Experience and a sound understanding of network environments (TCP/IP, Cisco routers/switches, Firewall, Load Balancers, Wi-Fi) including an excellent understanding of telecommunications concepts and connectivity.





Strong understanding of Switching and Routing - Cisco Catalyst Switches: 2950, 2960, 9200, 3750, 3850, 4500 series, 6500 series, Cisco Nexus 2k/5k/7k/9k





Hands-on experience with Palo Alto Firewalls, F5 Load balancers, Aruba or Cisco Wi-Fi, Cisco Viptela SDWAN, Cisco ACI, VMware NSX is a definite asset for this position.





Proficient in executing diagnostic techniques with a sound foundation of monitoring tools which include Tivoli ITNM, Vitalnet, QIP, Netscout, and Riverbed.





Virtualization, Cloud Computing, Network Security, VMware, AWS





Sound second-level problem determination and problem source identification skills with regards to the various network technologies utilized within the client globally.





  

Specific Educational Requirements / Accreditations






Technology Degree/Diploma or equivalent work experience.





Must have Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification coupled with 5 years of experience





Palo Alto Network Certified Network Security Engineer (PCNSE) and certification in MS Azure are a definite plus





  

Must Haves:






CCNP (R&S) Cert (CCNP certified with minimum 3 years of troubleshooting experience OR CCNA certified with min 5 years of troubleshooting experience)





Routing and switching





Troubleshooting experience/Break fixes





  

Nice to have:






CCNP (SDWAN) Cert





Hands-on experience with:





Cisco Viptela SDWAN





Cisco ACI





Palo Alto firewalls





F5 load balancers





VMware NSX





  

Degree/Certifications Required:
 





CCNP OR CCNA certification is a must-have

description:
Position Overview




As part of the IT Network Infrastructure team located primarily at the Scotiabank Arena, you will be responsible for the day-to-day administration, security, and enhancement of the internal network operations.  The role expects prompt IT troubleshooting and solutions along with a variety of on-going projects to support both the business and team operations.




Responsibilities





Architecting and Supporting the Route/Switch unicast and multicast topologies around always evolving business requirements.

Administration of multi-site Wi-Fi 6 Wireless Infrastructure on both the scale of small offices and high-density venues.

Governing of both physical and virtualized firewalling policies and management spread across multiple vendors.

Oversee Network access through management of a Network Access Control deployment.

Support of IPsec VPN Implementations.

Responsible for Data Center Network technology and support for the IT Systems Administrators.

Configuration of Cloud Networking objects to maintain connectivity within a Hybrid Cloud & On-Premises architecture.

Operate and configure IPAM, DNS & DHCP Services.

Attention of all monitoring and alarm systems to maintain maximum service availability and uptime.

Researching to recommend and implement more suitable technical solutions.

Automation of repetitive tasks to enhance team efficiency.

Ownership of all technical issues from initial diagnosis until their full resolution.

Tracking system end of life and determining appropriate replacement devices.

Documentation of existing systems as well as new implementations.

Remote Support for monitoring and responding to issues with business-critical services.

Aide Gameday/Event technical support staff with any configuration or support assistance requests they receive.

Contribute and assist with the training and support of Service Desk staff on networking technologies.  Would be required to provide guides and solutions to assist in reducing common problems.

Liaise with our various vendors and partners on their products and system technology

Communicate effectively and efficiently with colleagues and management.

Take pride in the organization and its people, maintaining professionalism and confidentiality.

Perform other administrative or service functions as requested by management.




Qualifications




7+ Years of IT Networking Experience in Administration and Technology Implementation

Certifications such as CCNP, CWNE, PCNSA

Strong Fundamental knowledge of Routing & Switching protocols

Experience with Cisco SD-WAN & ACI or other software defined networking solutions

Experienced with modern generation firewall administration with Cisco, Fortigate and Palo Alto

Proven network engineering, network operations and analysis skills

Familiarity with Wireless Administration, notably in high density environments

Exceptional to quickly diagnose & resolve networking problems

Proficiency with scripting languages a plus

Strong interpersonal skills to communicate with non-technical individuals about complex items

Exceptional written, oral and communication skills

Proven time management skills and must be reliable to adhere to time sensitive deadlines

Ability to work as part of a team and independently with minimal supervision

Available to work evenings and weekends as required




Additional Information




Please apply by: March 22, 2022





We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Partnership will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process. If you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email accommodations@mlse.com. Please note this email is only for accommodation requests. Resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
What You’ll Do

As a part of the Research And Efficacy Team (RET) supporting Cisco Security products, you will provide security research, detection content development and support assistance. You will work towards keeping yourself abreast of the latest malware techniques on Mac OSX, Linux and Windows. You will Investigate, analyze and respond to malware incidents and collaborate with other security researchers to help address customer concerns and provide product efficacy gap guidance. You will develop security content, provide domain expertise, and perform root cause analysis of potential security incidents all to help protect customers from breaches and cyber attacks.

Who You’ll Work With

The RET secures and protect customers through phenomenal products and takes a lead in customer focus, research and delivery. We work to understand attacker tactics, techniques and procedures at the deepest levels and write detection logic to detect and prevent cyber attacks. We work with data scientists, machine learning specialists, threat hunters and software developers to identify and remediate security gaps where they exist.

Who You Are

You have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline with experience or interest in reverse engineering of malware.

A deep understanding of operating system internals and strive to understand low-level details.

Experience in analyzing network pcaps, process memory, malicious scripts and executables.

Scripting skills with knowledge of Python, Bash and Powershell.

Software development skills in C, C++ or Go.

Used Red-teaming tools such as Metasploit, CobaltStike, Powershell Empire etc.

Prior experience in sandbox technologies, threat hunting, security operations or managed defence will be preferred.

Work collaboratively in a multi-disciplinary team, providing domain expertise when needed.

Able to communicate with both internal and external parties in a clear and concise way.

Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

industries: Telecommunications
description:
Code de demande: 354478

Chez Bell, on ne se contente pas de construire des réseaux de calibre mondial, d’élaborer des services novateurs et de créer du contenu pour des médias multiplateformes : on transforme la façon dont les Canadiens communiquent entre eux et avec le reste du monde.

Si vous êtes prêt à donner corps à des idées innovatrices et à vous joindre à une entreprise qui encourage, le développement professionnel et le bien-être de ses employés, l’équipe Bell est faite pour vous.

Bell investit comme jamais dans nos réseaux optiques et sans fil large bande, les meilleurs au monde, parce que nous savons qu'ils constituent l'épine dorsale des produits et des services que nos clients adorent. Si la perspective de faire évoluer les façons dont les gens communiquent vous enchante, il y a une place pour vous au sein du groupe Réseau.



À Propos De Nous



L’équipe Développement de technologies du réseau d’accès radio a pour mission de valider et de mettre en œuvre des améliorations à la technologie d’accès RF pour Bell/ Bell Mobilité afin de :


Réhausser l’expérience client

Réduire les incidences opérationnelles

Réduire les dépenses d’exploitation et optimiser les dépenses liées à l’amélioration de couverture et de la capacité RF




Tâches Et Responsabilités



Relevant du gestionnaire principal du développement de l’accès radio, l’architecte de réseau d’accès radio sera responsable des tâches suivantes :


Développement technique de l'architecture, des équipements, de la performance et des éléments de capacité pour les réseaux 5G et LTE-A afin de faire évoluer le réseau de Bell Mobilité et d’offrir de nouveaux services.

Évaluer, diriger et influencer les feuilles de route des équipementiers de réseaux d’accès afin d'apporter une valeur ajoutée au client, réaliser les objectifs de l’entreprise et répondre aux exigences d'évolution du réseau.

Mener des tests applicatifs préalables, de pré-production en laboratoire et sur le terrain afin de bien comprendre tous les aspects de la performance du système sans fil pour assurer une intégration transparente des nouveaux équipements dans les réseaux sans fil.

Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les membres d’une équipe multidisciplinaire pour soutenir le déploiement final des équipements et des fonctions du réseau d’accès en production.

Assurer une compréhension claire des performances du réseau et du développement d’IRC (KPI) et des compteurs afin que les offres des fournisseurs répondent à nos besoins.

Présenter les sujets techniques à diverses audiences (Exploitation, Ingénierie, Technologies sans-fil et Gestionnaires).

Gérer les relations avec les fournisseurs et les partenaires clés afin que les besoins de l’entreprise soient satisfaits.

Effectuer de la recherche, des essais et des analyses (y compris l’analyse coûts-revenus) en ce qui a trait aux nouveaux équipements d’accès sans fil qui améliorent la couverture, la capacité ainsi que la performance des systèmes et qui permettent des économies accrues des dépenses d’exploitation.

Travailler dans un environnement employant la méthode agile et contribuer à l’amélioration des processus de développement.




Qualifications/ Compétences Requises




Baccalauréat en génie électrique/ingénierie des systèmes avec spécialisation en télécommunications et de 5 à 10 années d’expérience dans l’un des types d’entreprises suivants : 

Fournisseur de services sans fil (service de l’ingénierie ou des technologies)

Fournisseur d’infrastructures sans fil (ingénierie RF, conception de systèmes, IdO (IOT) ou service de recherche et développement)

FEO (OEM) - réseau et service IdO (OEM) terminaux

Excellente connaissance des systèmes de radios cellulaires

Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication orale et écrite : Capacité de simplifier et d'expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences diverses (ingénieurs, techniciens, dirigeants)

Solides aptitudes pour le leadership technique et la gestion du temps

Orienté vers les résultats

Joueur d’équipe

Capacité de motiver les gens à participer à divers projets de développement

Capacité de faire preuve d’innovation et d’originalité (esprit visionnaire) pour résoudre les problèmes




Qualifications/ Compétences Souhaitées




Expérience avec la 5G, le LTE, le flux d'appels LTE-A, l'admission des appels, la gestion de la mobilité, la capacité RF et la performance réseau

Capacité à extraire des informations critiques à partir d'un grand nombre de registres (registres mobiles ou réseau) afin d'évaluer correctement les bénéfices liés à l'introduction de nouvelles fonctionnalités

Connaissance des eNode B et des gNode B Ericsson/Huawei/Nokia (conception, capacité) et de leurs limitations

Expérience d’essais en laboratoire d'équipement RF. Connaissance de l'équipement d'essai RF, comme les analyseurs de spectre

Expérience avec les SON(Self-Organizing-Network) et les composantes et outils centralisés SON

Expérience en déploiement, en optimisation et en techniques de délestage du trafic de petites cellules

Expérience pratique en essais technologiques préliminaires et en activités d'essai seraient un atout.

Expérience pratique avec les analyseurs de protocoles comme Accuver XCAL/XCAP Qualcomm QXDM et Wireshark

Chez Bell, nous n’acceptons pas seulement la différence, nous la célébrons. Nous nous engageons à créer un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible, où tous les membres du personnel se sentent valorisés, respectés et soutenus, et peuvent atteindre leur plein potentiel.

description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Are you a customer support engineer who is obsessed with delivering a great experience, but you’ve already mastered your current products and are wondering what’s next? Or are you a software engineer looking for a way to get introduced to an immense set of product architectures, domains, and tech stacks? Sure, you could join any new company and learn their handful of products, but we think we have something better.

We are the Customer Support team at Trilogy. We support over 100 unique enterprise software products - everything from mobile app development platforms to database load-balancers. We not only have the opportunity to learn, use, and support these products, we also become deep technical experts who can solve problems no one has seen before. There’s a lot to learn, so we have weekly “learning tickets” to ensure the whole team is up to speed.

This role is the highest-level customer support engineer we have - our tickets cannot be elevated above you. The problems are complex. The solutions might be configuration, database-level, or even code-level. Trilogy takes pride in its customer support quality and makes sure customers are impressed at every interaction. It’s an immense responsibility, but one that can put you on the fast track to career advancement.



What You Will Be Doing




Impressing customers by solving complex or new problems

Growing your product knowledge, in breadth and depth

Digging deep to discover the root causes and solutions of issues - exploring source code, databases, logs, and traces




What You Won’t Be Doing




Answering the same questions over and over again

Providing trivial or basic troubleshooting

Writing knowledge base articles




Technical Support Engineer Key Responsibilities




Resolving elevated customer tickets

Expanding product and technology expertise by working on “learning tickets”




Basic Requirements




2+ years of software development

2+ years of experience with customer-facing technical support

Availability for 8-hour shifts




About Trilogy



Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!


Working with Crossover


This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.


What to expect next:



You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.

Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.



Important!
 If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.

Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

description:
Meta Connectivity is constantly iterating to solve problems, co-develop solutions and deploy networks through direct engagement with the global telecoms industry, including network operators, network equipment vendors and communities such as the Telecom Infra Project (TIP). We are looking for a practical, system thinker and technical expert who respectfully questions the status quo to discover and implement high impact solutions. If you have passion for networks and want to work with network operators, industry partners, and internal teams to drive innovative, cost efficient solutions that accelerate the scaled deployment of a faster internet – then this is a great role for you.As an Indoor Wi-Fi Solutions Engineer, you will engage with Meta Connectivity engineering and product teammates as well as TIP OpenWiFi community members to design, develop, trial and deploy Wi-Fi solutions. In parallel, you will interface with industry leading partners including hardware/software vendors and system solution providers. Finally, you will work closely with network operators technical teams to understand how Meta and its partner’s contributions can be of most impact for indoor connectivity.-------Meta Connectivity fait sans cesse des itérations pour résoudre des problèmes, codévelopper des solutions et déployer des réseaux en collaboration directe avec l'industrie mondiale des télécommunications, y compris les opérateurs de réseaux, les vendeurs d'équipement et des communautés telles que Telecom Infra Project (TIP). Nous recherchons une personne à l'esprit pratique et à la pensée systémique, qui questionne le statu quo avec respect afin de découvrir et mettre en pratique des solutions à grande portée. Si vous êtes passionné(e) pour les réseaux et que vous voulez travailler avec des opérateurs de réseaux, des partenaires de l'industrie et des équipes à l'interne pour produire des solutions novatrices, rentables et efficaces qui permettront d'accélerer le déploiement à grande échelle d'un réseau internet plus rapide, alors ceci est un rôle parfait pour vous.En tant qu'ingénieur(e) wifi d'intérieur, vous collaborerez avec vos équipiers à l'ingénierie et aux produits chez Meta Connectivity ainsi qu'avec des membres de la communauté TIP OpenWiFi pour concevoir, développer, mettre à l'essai et déployer des solutions wifi. Parallèlement, vous communiquerez avec des partenaires éminents au sein de l'industrie, dont des vendeurs de produits matériels/logiciels et des fournisseurs de solutions système. Finalement, vous travaillerez de près avec les équipes techniques d'opérateurs de réseaux pour comprendre comment les contributions de Meta et de ses partenaires peuvent produire le plus grand impact pour la connectivité d'intérieur.

Indoor Connectivity Solutions Engineer | Ingénieur(e) en solutions de connectivité d'intérieur Responsibilities:



Develop use cases & requirements, architect, design, develop, and test solutions working closely with network operators, SaaS cloud providers, ODM hardware providers, application vendors (ISVs), system integrators (SIs), as well as internal engineering, product, and cross-functional teams. | Développer des cas d'utilisation et des exigences, faire l'architecture, la conception, le développement et le test de solutions en collaboration étroite avec des opérateurs de réseaux, des fournisseurs infonuagiques SaaS, des fournisseurs de matériel ODM, des éditeurs de logiciels indépendants (ELI), des intégrateurs de systèmes (IS), ainsi qu'avec des équipes d'ingénierie, de produits et multi-disciplinaires à l'interne.

Support the Community Development of Open Indoor Systems that enable network operators to quickly adopt innovative, lowest total cost of ownership approaches for indoor connectivity. | Soutenir le Développement communautaire de systèmes d'intérieur ouverts, qui permet aux opérateurs de réseaux d'adopter rapidement des approches novatrices et à faible coût pour la connectivité d'intérieur.

Work closely with and support network operators and infrastructure providers to plan and execute deployment projects from lab/field/market trials to scale deployments. | Travailler de près et soutenir les opérateurs de réseaux et les fournisseurs d'infrastructure pour la planification et l'exécution de projets de déploiment, depuis les essais en labo/sur le terrain/sur le marché jusqu'au déploiment à grande échelle.

Strong communication, interpersonal, and collaboration experience with both external partners (technical & non-technical) and internal cross-functional teams. | Solide expérience en communication, en relations interpersonnelles et en collaboration, autant avec des partenaires à l'externe (techniques et non techniques) qu'avec des équipes multi-disciplinaires à l'interne.

Willingness to work within partner - vendor facilities, able to travel up to 10% time, and/or cross-time zone calls. | Volonté de travailler sur des sites appartenant à des partenaires/vendeurs, capacité à voyager jusqu'à 10 % du temps et/ou à effectuer des appels hors de son fuseau horaire.



Minimum Qualifications:



Experience working across technical domains and organizations to identify, describe and define end-to-end solutions and approaches | Expérience de travail multidisciplinaire et avec plusieurs organisations pour identifier, décrire et définir des solutions et des approches intégrées.

Experience with network centric software architecture, data model, and API design & implementation | Expérience avec l'architecture logicielle, la modélisation de données et la conception d'API réseaucentriques.

Experience with Linux Foundation (LF) Networking/network operating systems | Expérience avec les systèmes d'exploitation et de réseautage de la Fondation Linux (FL).

Experience in one or more scripting languages such as Python, Bash, etc., and debugging scripting issues | Expérience avec un ou plusieurs langages de script, tels que Python, Bash, etc., ainsi qu'avec le débogage de problèmes de scriptage.

Experience with micro-services architectures for network management and automation systems | De l'expérience dans le domaine des architectures micro-services pour les systèmes de gestion et d'automatisation des réseaux.

Knowledge of core network, Access Network design and Edge Computing/Function Virtualization | Connaissance du réseau central, de la conception du réseau d'accès et de l'informatique de périphérie/de la virtualisation des fonctions.

Experience with operator back office OSS systems including Inventory, Assurance and Service Activation | De l'expérience dans les systèmes OSS de service d'appui des opérateurs, notamment l'inventaire, l'assurance et l'activation des services.

Experience with release engineering, CI/CD tools, DevOps tools (Ansible, Jenkins, Docker, etc.), and automated testing of network software | Expérience avec l'ingénierie de mise en production, les outils CI/CD, les outils DevOps (Ansible, Jenkins, Docker, etc.) et le test de logiciels réseau automatisé.

Firm understanding of mobile and in-building wireless network infrastructure and architectures | Connaissance approfondie de l'infrastructure et des architectures des réseaux sans fil mobiles et internes aux bâtiments.

Familiarity with the evolution and recent development of cellular and Wi-Fi wireless networking | Familiarité avec l'évolution et le développement récent des réseaux sans fil cellulaires et Wi-Fi

Experience with Wi-Fi back office systems including captive portals, network assist, authentication and redirection | Expérience avec les systèmes wifi administratifs, incluant les portails captifs, l'aide au réseautage, l'authentification et la redirection

Experience understanding and describing network management and automation solutions for multiple deployment and operations scenarios including in-building/outdoor uses cases, fixed/mobile access, enterprise/public access | De l'expérience dans la compréhension et la description des solutions de gestion et d'automatisation des réseaux pour de multiples scénarios de déploiement et d'exploitation, y compris les cas d'utilisation à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur des bâtiments, l'accès fixe/mobile, l'accès aux entreprises et au public.

Communication skills including experience talking to both technical and business audiences. Knowledge to collaborate with both external partners and internal cross-functional teams | Habiletés en communication, incluant de l'expérience avec des auditoires provenant des milieux techniques et des affaires. Connaissances permettant de collaborer avec des partenaires externes ainsi qu'avec des équipes multidisciplinaires à l'interne.

Understanding of business-related aspects of a solution, and proven to interact with business teams on technical & economic aspects of a solution | Compréhension des aspects commerciaux d'une solution, et preuve d'expérience en interaction avec des équipes en milieu d'affaires sur les aspects techniques et économiques d'une solution.

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta. | Possède, ou est en train d'obtenir une licence en informatique, en génie informatique, dans un domaine technique pertinent, ou une expérience pratique équivalente. Le diplôme doit être obtenu avant de rejoindre Meta.



Preferred Qualifications:

Interview: On this weekend Saturday morning shift EST



 



Role: Software Developer in Test (SDET)



Location: Toronto, ON



Hiring: Contract and full time both are okay



 



Responsibilities


•	A Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field.

•	Excellent designing and programming skills.

•	Knowledge of programming languages and process management methodology.

•	Knowledge of test methodologies and their corresponding tools.

•	Exposure to Behaviour Driven Development and experience in programming and testing.

•	The ability to recognize risks and errors in an application.

•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

•	Good time management and organizational skills.

•	The ability to keep current with the constantly changing technology industry.

•	A passion for testing, development, and design

industries: Movies and Sound Recording
description:
Company Description



This job application remains open even when we don’t have roles available. If you would like to be considered, please apply and we will contact you as soon as we have an opening


Technicolor Creative Studios is powered by world-leading visual effects, advertising, animation and games brands around the world; from Moving Picture Company, and Mr.X, to The Mill, and Mikros, to the recently-launched Technicolor Games.

Our studios have worked on the spectacular scenes and tiny details that make movies, advertising campaigns, animation and games truly mind-blowing. We’re the people behind creative delivery in countless blockbuster films such as 1917, The Lion King, The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge on the Run, Cruella, game animations for titles including Call of Duty, Resident Evil and Need for Speed and advertising campaigns for some of the biggest brands in the world including Apple, Nike, Samsung and Audi.

The Technicolor Creative Studios team is wildly creative, exceptionally talented and extremely passionate about the possibilities we make happen in our industry. We are looking for more of the very best talent to join us.


Job Description


The Engineer manages the development of the ongoing internal creative and technical training programs as well as the internal training platform and training tools using Technicolor technologies. They work closely with the HOD and Department Trainers to develop training outcomes, coordinate training technical resources across sites, project manage training programs such as new starter training, upskilling, cross-training, show-specific training, and masterclasses.


Responsibilities



Work with production teams to collect requirements for developing and scheduling up and coming show specific technical training

Develop, manage, and execute the studio’s training processes, platform, tools, and programs.

Plan, design and coordinate the development and the deployment of company-wide studio tools and their training programs.

Maintain the standards and be an administrator to the Learning Management System.

Assess, test, troubleshoot and maintain systems and platform in order to ensure the availability and integrity of training materials across sites.

Assist in the creation of new VFX Academy technical programs., in person learning and other development programs.

Oversee and enforce the standards and creation of department technical documentation.

Oversee the documented history of workflows used on current and past VFX shows.

Create and present proposals for new technological training initiatives to the training management.

Report to the Head of Creative Training and Development.

Act as an administrator to the video sharing platform



Qualifications



Bachelor’s in Computer Engineering or relevant field

Is an excellent communicator, both written and verbal. 

Worked in VFX for 5+ years.

Can work independently within an organization to get information proactively.

Previous experience in a training organization.



Additional Information


Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to tcstalent@technicolor.com and we'll be happy to assist.


TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER


Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
About HashiCorp



At HashiCorp, we’re building a generation-defining infrastructure software company, powered by our core principles and a growing team of talented, committed professionals working together to help organizations seamlessly transition to and operate in the cloud. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in San Francisco, 85 percent of our employees work remotely, strategically distributed around the globe. From our inception we built the company with a remote-first approach because we believe talent has no boundaries.

Product Security Engineer

HashiCorp is a fast-growing startup that solves development, operations, and security challenges in infrastructure so organizations can focus on business-critical tasks. Our open source software is used by millions of users to provision, secure, connect, and run any infrastructure for any application. The Global 2000 uses our enterprise software to accelerate application delivery and drive innovation through software.

We are looking for Product Security Engineers to help scale our product security function, which works closely with engineering & product management to ensure that security is appropriately addressed across the HashiCorp suite of cloud and self-managed products. This role will report to our Director of Product Security.

Security at HashiCorp is a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.



In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Include




Contribute to secure architecture and design of HashiCorp products.

Work across various product and engineering teams to prioritize security features and bugs, and ensure implementation and mitigations.

Monitor threats and vulnerabilities impacting HashiCorp products and services; triage reported vulnerabilities, identify mitigations and assess/communicate associated risk.

Plan & execute security assessments (dynamic testing, static testing, code review, etc) and threat modeling of HashiCorp’s products, services, and associated cloud infrastructure.

Build and implement security solutions across the product life-cycle, such as standalone security tools, CI/CD pipeline integrations, product security features/fixes, etc.

Act as SME on multiple information security areas (e.g. security architecture, application security, threat modeling etc.)

Assist in execution of 3rd-party audits, penetration tests, and bug bounty programs.

Contribute to the creation and delivery of security training.

Research emerging attack vectors and techniques.


We are looking for talented self-starters with 4+ years of security experience. We will consider experienced engineers with less security-specific experience but the desire to learn!


You may be a good fit if you have knowledge and experience around:



Product / service architectures in modern cloud environments (IaaS, SaaS, PaaS).

Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Modern engineering practices, processes, and tools, particularly related to the Go programming language and ecosystem.

Secure development practices, and integration into broader engineering activities.

Secure operations practices, specifically wrt. cloud environments.

Application and infrastructure security testing methodologies and tools.

Security design / architecture and threat modeling.

Vulnerabilities (old and new), and options for defense / mitigation.

Product vulnerability management lifecycle.

Security audits, penetration tests, and/or bug bounty programs.

Cryptography and cryptographic libraries.


HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be. Interested, and think you might be a fit? Apply today!

HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

For more information regarding how HashiCorp collects, uses, and manages personal information, please review our Privacy Policy.
