industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Find out about FDM’s Coronavirus (COVID-19) preparations 
here
.







Note


: Please only submit one application, even if you are interested in more than one opportunity. A recruiter will speak to you about all options available after we review your application. Please note this role is part of our graduate program.





Our people are our passion at FDM. That’s why we make your training and career growth a priority. Since 2014, we have launched the tech careers of over 
2,000
 people in Canada. FDM is currently seeking numerous ambitious and driven candidates with the aptitude for IT to work as FDM consultants. We help people like you make their first step into tech every day. Are you ready to make yours?





About This Role 


As a Junior Cloud Computing Engineer with FDM, you will undergo industry specific training and continue your career journey as an FDM consultant by working for one of our globally recognized clients. Some common positions you could be working in include Cloud Support Engineer or Analyst, Cloud Network Engineer, Technical Support Engineer and more.




As a
 Junior Cloud Computing Engineer 
you will gain invaluable hands-on experience while helping large organizations make the shift from traditional IT methods and overseeing all technological tasks involving the cloud. You will have the opportunity to create breakthrough cloud environments, as well as diagnose and fix issues to improve existing cloud-based systems to revolutionize business. You will receive training in Azure or AWS, Python and SQL. This will equip you with a versatile toolkit of software, languages and platform knowledge to carry with you throughout your professional career. You will also learn how to gather requirements for cloud-based environments, monitor and decommission cloud environments which are no longer required and perform standard monitoring, disaster recovery and maintenance tasks.




This position is ideal for 
final year students hoping to secure an entry-level job upon graduation. 
No previous qualifications or STEM Field experience is required.





Minimum Qualifications



Degree or Diploma (preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar).

A natural aptitude for technology and a strong desire to expand your technical skill set.

Able to commit to work for FDM for a minimum of two years working as an FDM consultant following the training period.

Eligible to work in Canada.






Benefits



A chance to work for some of the most prestigious companies in the world.

Opportunity to earn professional certifications related to your career path.

Two-year contract in industry.

Continuous career support and upskilling from FDM.

Comprehensive and competitive benefits package.

Access to a network of mentors and like-minded individuals.

Industry recognized paid training.






About the FDM Career Development Program


FDM’s Career Development Program is a great way for students to enter the job market upon graduation. At FDM, we train the brightest talent to become the innovators of tomorrow. Technology makes the world a better place and we believe passion, drive and curiosity are what you need to have a successful career in tech. This is why we do not require any previous experience to join FDM’s Career Development Program.




FDM’s two-year program begins with training in one of our career streams in business and technology that are in high demand in the job market. We will provide you with the industry-specific technical and professional skills you need in your chosen stream, after which you will start working as an FDM Consultant with our globally recognized clients.




Upon completion of the program, many graduates see their journey with FDM culminating in an accelerated career progression, better placing them to apply for senior roles within the industry.


 



 






 




 




Diversity and Inclusion


Diversity and inclusion are at the heart of what we value as an organization. FDM is a globally recognized organization with centers across seventeen countries globally. We are proud to celebrate our employee backgrounds consisting over 85 nationalities.




FDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial or local laws.

industries: Software Development and Financial Services
description:
Who Is Recruiting From Scratch



Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.



About Our Client



Our client, is a next-generation financial services company building a better banking experience to help teens and young adults achieve financial independence and knowledge at an earlier age. They’re on a mission to improve the financial future of the next generation and empower teens to start their financial journey. Our client is a well-funded Series C company that has raised more than $175M, focused on disrupting banking through a differentiated mobile-first consumer experience.

They have eclipsed 1.5 million customers just four months after launch. If you’re looking to join a fast-growing company with a strong mission and vision that puts people first, our client wants to meet you.


The Role


Our client is looking for a Senior Backend Software Engineer. As part of the team you’ll be at the forefront of developing new core banking features and helping them deliver their first product to the public.



Responsibilities




Be a security subject matter expert and respond to any internal security engineering questions/request

Work in a small, tight knit cross-functional team

Work with other teams to help architect solutions that are inherently secure

Effectively balance security risk and product advancement

Oversee penetration testing

Build threat models

See your contributions make a weekly impact to an evolving product



Must Haves



BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field

5+ years relevant work experience

Well versed in Cloud Infrastructure and Mobile Application Security



Core Technologies Used



Google Cloud Platform

Google Kubernetes Engine

Backend: Kotlin, Java

Mobile: React Native and Typescript



Working For Our Client 



Competitive salary based on experience, with full medical and dental benefits 

High potential for growth 

Stock in an early-stage startup 

Flexible WFH and vacation policy 

Employee referral program 

Monthly stipend for client card testing 

401K plan

industries: Truck Transportation and Railroad Equipment Manufacturing
description:
Req ID: 255242

Nous créons des innovations intelligentes pour relever les défis de la mobilité d’aujourd'hui et de demain. Nous concevons et fabriquons une gamme complète de systèmes de transport, des trains à grande vitesse aux bus électriques et trains sans conducteur, en passant par les solutions d'infrastructure, de signalisation et de mobilité digitale. Nous rejoindre, c’est intégrer une communauté internationale de plus 75 000 personnes qui se consacrent à la résolution de problèmes de mobilité concrets et à la réalisation de projets internationaux ayant un impact local durable.

Avec des activités croissantes au Canada pour répondre à la demande grandissante de transport durable, Alstom recherche des candidats motivés qui nous aideront à tirer parti de notre expertise et à l'appliquer localement. Nous avons l'énergie et l'esprit d'une start-up avec les fondations d'une entreprise multinationale de classe mondiale qui encourage la collaboration, l'esprit d'entreprise, la créativité et le respect de l'environnement. Notre offre aux employés comprend des opportunités de développement de carrière et de vastes perspectives de mobilité interne à travers le monde.


 Objet de l’emploi (Ingénieur Système ICC en Chef) 


Le but est d’accomplir un mandat d'Ingénieur Système ICC (Integrated Control Center) en Chef dans le cadre de différents projets ICC qui fournissent généralement un système ICC composé d'au moins un produit ICONIS et d'au moins l'un des sous-systèmes suivants : SCADA (Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition), ATS (Automated Train Supervision) et MSM (Maintenance and Security Management).

Il est important de mentionner que l'Ingénieur Système ICC en Chef, devra combiner un rôle de leadership avec un rôle technique, étant en même temps responsable du travail de l’équipe d’Ingénierie Système mais aussi de toute la documentation Système et de la cohésion entre les niveaux Système et Sous-système.

Dans une première phase, l'Ingénieur Système ICC en Chef participera à la définition des spécifications détaillées du projet RER. Dans une deuxième phase, correspondant aux étapes ultérieures du projet RER ou d’autres projets futurs, son mandat sera étendu à un rôle complet d'Ingénieur Système ICC en Chef, tel que décrit ci-dessous.


 Contexte: 


Chez Alstom, un ingénieur système ICC est généralement impliqué au début et à la fin du cycle de développement en V d'Alstom, plus précisément pendant les phases de spécification et

d'architecture du système, d'intégration et de validation, d'un projet ICC donné. Une autre partie importante du mandate consiste à examiner la documentation des sous-systèmes et à fournir un soutien aux équipes des sous-systèmes pour assurer la cohérence des sous-systèmes avec l'ensemble du système. L'Ingénieur Système ICC en Chef doit, en plus, assumer la responsabilité technique de l’Équipe Système ainsi que celle des solutions choisies pour l’architecture du Système.

Le Projet RER vise à livrer un ICC basé sur un Système composé de plusieurs sous-systèmes tels que : Système de Contrôle de Trafic qui est en fait un ATS (Supervision Automatique des Trains), SCADA (Contrôle de Supervision et Acquisition de Données), MS (Système de Gestion des incidents), SIM (SIMulation environment), IPS (Integrated Playback System), GCS (Global Common Services) qui est en fait un middleware.

Étant donné qu’à l’état courant du projet RER les requis Système ainsi que l’architecture globale sont définis à un très haut niveau, le but principal de l’Équipe Système sera de les détailler davantage, de confirmer la fonctionnalité finale et d’ajouter les détails de conception (design) nécessaires

À terme, dans le cadre des étapes suivantes du projet RER ou dans le cadre de projets ICC ultérieurs, l'Ingénieur Système ICC en Chef assumera un ensemble complet de responsabilités, telles que définies ci-dessous.


 Objectifs 


Conduire techniquement l’équipe d’Ingénierie Système

Conduire les activités d’architecture Système

Coordonner les activités d’Ingénierie Système en coopération avec les équipes de CyberSécurité et Safety, pour identifier les risques et proposer des mitigations

Assurer la cohésion et l’uniformité de la documentation Système (requis, architecture)

Rédiger et mettre à jour les spécifications Système, en veillant à ce que toutes les exigences soient réalisables et mesurables ; rédiger des Documents de Contexte Opérationnel (dont les User Stories) et les présenter aux autres équipes.

Participer au processus d'intégration des versions livrées par des différents sous-systèmes, les produits Alstom et les interfaces externes

Participer au processus de validation du système et/ou du sous-système dans son ensemble (en incluant les différents sous-systèmes, les produits Alstom et les interfaces externes) et s'assurer qu'il répond à toutes les exigences, conformément à la documentation d'Alstom et au contrat initial avec le Client.


 Mesure d’attente des Objectifs 


Respecter tous les indicateurs de projet QCDP (Qualité, Coût, Délai, Performance de livraison)

Obtenir l'approbation du Client pour tous les documents créés/mis à jour, liés aux spécifications, à la conception, à l'intégration et à la validation du projet

Atteindre tous les objectifs globaux d’Alstom


 Responsabilités 


Responsable technique de l’Équipe Système :


 Conduire techniquement l’Équipe d’Ingénierie Système



Globalement:


 Concevoir une solution système en ligne avec les besoins du projet

 Identifier les spécificités projet (en anglais GAP) et les solutions possibles pour les combler

 Discuter les solutions système avec le Client

 Gérer les solutions système tout au long de l'exécution du projet

 Gérer les interfaces internes et externes

 S'assurer que les composants de la solution sont développés correctement







 Définir les règles des applications ainsi que le processus d'ingénierie

 Déterminer la stratégie de migration et de déploiement du système

 Intégrer les composants de la solution dans le système fonctionnel



Spécifications du système et/ou du sous-système et conception de l'architecture :


 Rédiger les spécifications du système et/ou du sous-système (exigences) et la description du contexte opérationnel

 Mettre à jour la documentation de conception en fonction des revues internes (par les pairs) ou des commentaires des clients

 Mettre à jour et clarifier les spécifications (exigences) lors des phases de conception, de développement et de présentation des maquettes

 S'assurer que l'architecture et la conception du système sont conformes aux exigences RAM, sécurité, qualité et cybersécurité



Intégration système et/ou sous-système :


 Valider les procédures techniques définissant l'intégration du système, des sous-systèmes et des interfaces externes

 Assurer le suivi et fournir des conseils sur toutes les activités d'intégration entre le système, les sous-systèmes et les interfaces externes



Validation du système et/ou du sous-système :


 Suivre et fournir des conseils sur toutes les activités de validation au niveau du système, envoyer les anomalies identifiées aux sous-systèmes si nécessaire

 S'assurer que le système et/ou le sous-système est conforme à toutes les exigences du système et au contrat client d'origine ainsi qu'à toute autre exigence implicite en résultant



Support et suivi de la traçabilité des exigences, à partir du niveau système, jusqu'aux sous-systèmes et aux interfaces externes


 Compréhension de l’industrie 


Connaissance de l’industrie ferroviaire, ATS, SCADA, système de gestion des incidents, centre de contrôle


 Exigences en matière d’études 


Baccalauréat en génie électrique, en automatisation ou l’équivalent

Membre de l’Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ) ; Membre de l’Ordre des Ingénieurs Professionnels de l’Ontario (PEO) serait un atout


 Expérience technique 


5 ans d’expérience dans l’industrie ferroviaire

10 ans d’expérience en ingénierie système (spécifications système, architecture système, intégration de systèmes)

5 ans d’expérience avec des grands systèmes de centre de contrôle (transport, énergie, pipeline et similaires) et leurs défis d’intégration typiques

3 ans d’expérience avec au moins un produit ICONIS (ATS CF, ATS CT, S2K-AGUI, S2K-UHMI


 Aptitudes et compétences comportementales et techniques 


Solides compétences relationnelles et interpersonnelles

Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite, en anglais et en français, ainsi que d’excellentes compétences en présentation

Capacité de comprendre et d’écrire des scénarios opérationnels (User Stories)

Capacité de prise de décision technique, jugement judicieux, leadership, résolution de problèmes

Expérience avec Windows et Windows Server.

Expérience avec MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)

Connaissance des outils de gestion de la configuration (Clearcase, Perforce)

Connaissance de VM Ware, principes de base de SQL Server

Connaissance des principes de cybersécurité

Connaissance des principes Agile


 Lieu de travail 


Montréal (Québec), Canada.

À l’occasion, dans d’autres provinces canadiennes (c.-à-d. l’Ontario) ou à l’étranger, pour aider à différentes activités d’intégration et aux essais sur le terrain


 Heures de travail 


Selon la politique des Ressources Humaines d’Alstom


 Vacances 


Selon la politique des Ressources Humaines d’Alstom

English Version Below


Purpose of the Job


To fulfill an ICC (Integrated Control Center) Lead System Engineer mandate within the context of different ICC Projects which typically deliver one ICC System consisting of at least one ICONIS Product and at least one of the following subsystems: SCADA (Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition), ATS (Automated Train Supervision) and MSM (Maintenance and Security Management).

It is important to mention that the Lead System Engineer combines a leadership role with a technical one, mainly because he/she is the technical leader of the System Engineering Team and at the same time, the owner of the System documentation, responsible of the cohesion between the System level and the Subsystem level.

In a first phase, the ICC Lead System Engineer will participate in detailed specification definition on the RER Project. In a second phase, the mandate will be to perform a complete ICC Lead System Engineer role in subsequent phases of RER project or on other ICC Projects, as described below.


Organisation Structure


Alstom, Americas Region, DI&S (Digital & Integrated Systems) Organization, ICC Department, ICC Engineering Team


Organisational Reporting


Hierarchically reporting to the ICC System Engineer Manager or ICC Engineering Manager

Functionally reporting to the PrEM (Project Engineering Manager) or equivalent Engineering Leader on the assigned project


Network & Links


Alstom Systems & Products Community

Alstom Methods & Tools Community

Project-specific communities:


 Project Core Team 

 System Team 

 Integration Team 

 Validation Team 

 Product Team 

 Customer 

 Interface Partners 



Project EHS Manager/Coordinator or RC EHS Manager/Engineer


Context:


At Alstom, an ICC System Engineer is typically involved at the beginning and at the end of Alstom’s development Vee-cycle, more precisely during the system specification & architecture and during the integration and validation phases, of a given ICC Project. Another important part of the mandate is to review subsystem documentation and provide support to subsystem teams to ensure consistency of subsystems with the overall system. On top of all that, the ICC Lead System Engineer, has the technical responsibility of the System Team and the responsibility of the selected system-architecture-related solutions.

The RER Project is aiming to deliver an ICC based on a System consisting of several subsystems, as follows: Traffic Control System which is actually an ATS (Automatic Train Supervision), SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition), MS (Management System), SIM (SIMulation environment), IPS (Integrated Playback System), GCS (Global Common Services) which is actually a middleware.

Since, at the present state of the RER Project, the System requirements and the System architecture are still at a very high-level, the entire focus of the System Team in the next couple of years will be to detail further the initial requirements, to confirm final functionality and to follow up with the necessary design.

Eventually, through the following stages of the RER project or during subsequent ICC Projects, the ICC Lead System Engineer will be required to assume a complete set of responsibilities, as defined below.


Objectives:


To technically lead the system engineering team.

To lead the system architecture activities.

To coordinate with safety and cybersecurity teams to ensure the mitigation of risks.

To ensure the cohesion and consistency of the system documentation (requirements, architecture, etc.).

To coordinate with the subsystem teams the cross-functional interface.

To write and update System specifications, ensuring that all requirements are achievable and measurable; to write Operational Context Documents (including User Stories)

To participate at the integration process of the released versions of the different subsystems, Alstom Products and external interfaces

To participate at the validation process of the System as a whole (including different subsystems, Alstom Products and external interfaces) and ensure it meets all the requirements, as per Alstom documentation and per customer original contract


Measurement


Meet all the Project QCDP (Quality, Cost, Delivery Performance) indicators

Receive customer approval for all the created/updated Project Specification-, Design- and Integration and Validation-related documents

Meet all the Alstom-related objectives


Responsibilities


System Team technical leader:


 Technically lead the system engineering team 

 Coordinate the system engineering activities 

 Allocate tasks and ensure system engineering activities follow-up 



Overall:


 Design system solution in line with project needs 

 Identify project gaps and evolution path for solutions 

 Discuss system solution with the customer 

 Manage system solution throughout project execution 

 Control internal and external interfaces 

 Ensure solution components are developed properly 

 Define application rules and engineering process 

 Determine system migration and deployment strategy 

 Integrate solution components into functional system 



System specifications and architecture design:


 Write System specifications (requirements) and Operational context description 

 Update design documentation based on internal (peer) reviews or customer comments 

 Update and clarify the specifications (requirements) during the design, development, and mock-up presentation phases 

 Ensure the system Architecture and design complies with the RAM, Safety and Cybersecurity requirements 



System integration


 Validate technical procedures defining the integration of System, Subsystems and external interfaces 

 Follow-up and provide advice on all the integration activities between the System the Subsystems and external interfaces 



System validation


 Follow-up and provide advice on all the validation activities at System level, dispatch identified anomalies to Subsystems if necessary 

 Ensure that the System complies with all the System requirements and the original customer contract as well as with any other implicit requirements resulting thereof 

 Support and follow up on Requirements Traceability, starting from the System level, to subsystems and to external interfaces 




Business Understanding


Railroad industry knowledge, ATS, SCADA, Management System, Integrated Control Center


Educational Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, Automation, or equivalent

Member of Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ) and/or Professional Engineers of Ontario (PEO) an asset


Technical Knowledge / Experience


5-year experience in Railway industry

10-year experience in System Engineering (System Requirements, System Architecture, System Integration)

5-year experience with large Control Center Systems (Energy, Pipeline and similar) and their typical integration challenges

3-year exposure to at least one ICONIS Product (ATS CF, ATS CT, S2K-AGUI, S2K-UHMI)


Behavioural And Technical Skills / Competencies


Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills

Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and French, as well as excellent presentation skills

Ability to understand and to write User Stories (Operational scenarios)

Ability of technical decision making, sound judgment, assertiveness, problem solving

Experience with Windows and Windows server.

Experience with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)

Knowledge of configuration management tools (Clearcase, Perforce)

Knowledge of VM Ware, SQL server basics

Knowledge of distributed systems

Knowledge of network principles

Knowledge of CyberSecurity principles

Knowledge of Safety principles

Knowledge of Agile principles


Job Location 


Montreal (QC) Canada.

Occasionally, in other Canadian provinces (i.e. Ontario) or abroad, to assist at different integration and field-testing activities


Hours of Work


In accordance with the Alstom’s Human Resources policy.


Holiday Entitlement


In accordance with the Alstom’s Human Resources policy.

Les engagements de notre entreprise se fondent sur une culture agile, inclusive et responsable qui offre à des personnes de tout horizon l’opportunité de se développer, d’apprendre et de progresser tout au long de leur carrière. Nous encourageons nos salariés à réaliser pleinement leur potentiel, tout en leur accordant l’estime et le respect dus à chaque individu.

We’re hiring!

MOST WANTED: Embedded C++ developer.

Are you tired of chasing other people’s dreams or getting caught up in objectives and projects where you don’t understand the end goal? Are you at a point where you’d rather help a company and team write a success story where you play an active part?  Have you ever wondered what it would be like to directly see the fruits of your labor and see your efforts directly benefit customers, partners, and markets?  Where you can look back at your day and see that your tasks had a positive effect?

Very few engineers know this feeling today because they get caught up in endless coding or trouble shooting! At IENSO you will live the thrill and make a difference, we promise. We are a great team coming, keeping, and working together, and we are going far … together, as a team.

Come with us  https://ienso.recruitee.com

job_title: Software Development Engineer, Digital Commerce, Subscriptions
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon Digital Commerce powers ordering, subscriptions, and device management for Prime, Amazon Video, Music, Audible, Alexa, and Kindle, amongst other digital businesses. We process billions of digital purchases every year and enable our digital businesses to grow their businesses worldwide. We are on a mission to be earth's best provider of one-time and recurring digital commerce, delivering a seamless and enjoyable post-purchase customer experience.

Would you like to help us build a large-scale Software-As-A-Service (SAAS) solution for all subscription and membership businesses at Amazon? Are you excited about building distributed systems with really challenging mix of requirements on availability, latency and consistency? Are you someone who enjoys the challenge of figuring out scalable and reusable technical solutions in the context of business problems with ever-growing complexity? If the answers are yes, our team will offer you all of those opportunities, so please come talk to us!

As a Senior Engineer, you will lead projects involving multiple teams in all aspects of the SDLC using an agile process. As the systems need to be built from the ground up, you will have an opportunity to make a long-lasting impact.

To be successful in this position you will have a strong background in Algorithms, Data Structures, Java, and NoSQL. The ability to communicate clearly and concisely (both written and orally) and work well in a team are key competencies. You should be able to quickly adapt to new development environments, learn new systems, create reliable and maintainable code, and find creative and scalable solutions to difficult problems. Experience working with high-traffic, scalable services is a plus.



About The Team



We build and run mission critical commerce systems that power all subscription and membership use cases at Amazon. We are responsible for managing all aspects of a subscription's and digital ordering lifecycle at scale and providing the right extensibility in our APIs and data model to support the rapidly growing customization needs by the businesses that we support, among which are some the biggest and most complex at Amazon such as Prime world-wide and Alexa smart home subscriptions.




Basic Qualifications




 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.

 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience




Preferred Qualifications




 Deep hands-on technical expertise

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 Strong business and technical vision

 Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

 A deep understanding of software development in a team, and a track record of shipping software on time

 A solid understanding of best practices and techniques regarding web scalability, performance, and security.

 Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills and make them more effective and productive software engineers.


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Job ID: A1971046

industries: E-Learning Providers, Business Skills Training, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
Job Description



Title: 
Software Engineer – Portal


Reports to: 
Director, Digital Platforms


Location:
 Anywhere in the US, Canada, or Latin America





Job Summary


As a Software Engineer, you will build products to help organizations train their employees and overcome their most pressing people-related problems at scale. You will work with product, design, data, and content teams to build a modern learning platform, scaling usage (and impact) 10-100x in the next year.





Role Context


Historically FC primarily offered in-person, one-off training. Over the last five years we have made substantial investments, and have had significant success, transitioning the business to an online, subscription product (AAP). Earlier this year we acquired Strive, an edtech startup whose leadership development platform was used by leading tech companies like Slack, Airbnb, Pinterest and Intuit. Under the Strive's team direction and leadership, we are doubling down on their technology/product-centric approach and looking to build out a larger product and engineering team.





Why We Think This is a Great Opportunity



Interesting Product, Technical and Organizational Challenges – This year we will increase the number of users on Strive's learning platform 100 to 1000x. This will require us to solve a number of interesting product, technical and organizational challenges – whatever your unique interest is, there's likely a good challenge for you to work on.

Impact at Scale – FranklinCovey positively impacts the lives of millions of learners and tens of millions of their direct reports every year – FC directly teaches 4x as many learners in the US as all US business schools combined! By building out platform integrations for learning and planning in the flow of work, you'll substantially increase the quality of the learning experience and thus improve the skills and experiences of that enormous audience.

Startup Speed, Established Company Security – FranklinCovey's product & tech org is small relative to the company's learner/client scale, so you'll be able to move quickly to build a strategy and ship great products. Unlike a startup, FC is an established (and profitable!) publicly traded company, so you won't worry about the next funding round falling through and a lack of job security.






Essential Job Functions



Ideate: Engineers participate early in the product development process. You will review regular quantitative and qualitative research about our clients and learners and weigh in on the product strategy and roadmap.

Collaborate: You will partner with product, data and design to define the product features and functionality to ensure we're building the right thing at the right time and in the right way.

Build: You will ship regularly and iteratively, writing testable, readable and maintainable code.

Review & Architect: As a Senior Software Engineer you will play a leadership role in code reviews for the team, helping set the engineer bar, defining best practices, and weighing in on major architecture decisions.

Support: You will work with the sales, marketing, implementation and support teams to ensure users get the most value from the products you've built.






Job Requirements



5-10 years of experience building and shipping high-quality products (years of experience ≠ ability, this is a proxy but not a hard requirement)

Back-end experience with PHP, Python (Django), MySQL/PostgreSQL and front-end experience with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML is preferred but not required. We're looking for great engineers and are confident that you can learn the language with time and direction.

Drive to continually improve and share knowledge with your teammates.

Ability and experience mentoring/guiding/developing more junior engineers with code reviews, best practice sharing, and architecture decisions

Experience with performance, security, privacy, accessibility, and localization/globalization preferred but not required.

Experience architecting or refactoring systems of moderate complexity preferred but not required






Company Information


Franklin Covey Co. (NYSE: FC) is a global, public company, specializing in organizational performance improvement. We help organizations achieve results that require lasting changes in human behavior. Our world-class solutions enable greatness in individuals, teams and organizations and are accessible through the FranklinCovey All Access Pass® available in multiple modalities and in 21 languages. Clients have included the
 Fortune 100, Fortune 500
, thousands of small- and mid-sized businesses, numerous government entities, and educational institutions. FranklinCovey executes over 15,000 client engagements each year reaching into 160 countries and territories. Our mission statement is “We enable greatness in people and organizations everywhere”. We fulfill this mission by hiring “Achievers with Heart”.




Visit our website at www.franklincovey.com for more information regarding our organization.





FranklinCovey is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.






For additional information regarding our Equal Employment Opportunity policies, please visit https://sites.google.com/franklincovey.com/equal-employment-opportunity/home






For our Reasonable Accommodation Notice and Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision, please visit https://sites.google.com/franklincovey.com/equal-employment-opportunity/adaraptnp







 




Colorado applicants, please visit https://careers.franklincovey.com/en-US/page/benefits for benefits information and https://franklincovey365.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/NewHireDocsPublic/ESCGgpsOZTxKp5PPPWYZIR0BIS9h0CAv5g7Ya0WNg2WGkQ?e=ZB63d6 for wage information specific to your state.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) is an Amazon service for our sellers that offers our Amazon fulfillment centers as a service similar to how EC2 provides infrastructure. Allowing sellers to only pay for what they use, let us create a seamless experience for sellers to leverage our world-class facilities. 71% of sellers who use FBA report more than a 20% increase in unit sales after joining FBA.

In a very real way, we are changing lives with the work we do. Our FBA employees wake up every day thinking about how to enable our sellers to be successful on our platform. Enabling seller success allows us to provide Amazon customers with unparalleled selection and pricing. FBA is a win for sellers and a win for customers.

What is Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA)?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IAi4fPb_kp4&t=2s

The Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) team

https://vimeo.com/80948105

The Amazon FBA Inbound Quality Team is looking for a System Dev Engineer who will join the team which supports to reduce operational load on SDEs, raise the bar on operational excellence, automate issue resolution, and proactively mitigate the failures.

Your problem resolving skill will benefit customers directly, insuring Amazon able to meet all its commitments to our customers. Primary responsibilities include troubleshooting, diagnosing and fixing production software issues, developing monitoring solutions, performing software maintenance and configuration, implementing the fix for internally developed code (Perl, Ruby, C/C++, JAVA), performing SQL queries, updating, tracking and resolving technical challenges, build and develop tools which will automate daily operational activities. Responsibilities also include working alongside development on Amazon Corporate and Divisional Software projects, updating/enhancing our current software, automation of support processes and documentation of our systems.

Your solutions will impact our customers directly! This job requires you to constantly hit the ground running and your ability to learn quickly and work on disparate and overlapping tasks will define your success. High Impact production issues often require coordination between multiple Development, Operations and IT Support groups, so you get to experience a breadth of impact with various groups.

The ideal candidate must be detail oriented, have superior verbal and written communication skills, strong organizational skills, able to juggle multiple tasks at once, able to work independently and can maintain professionalism under pressure. You must be able to identify problems before they happen and implement solutions that detect and prevent outages. You must be able to accurately prioritize projects, make sound judgments, work to improve the customer experience, and get the right things done.




Basic Qualifications




 B.S. in Computer Science or a related field.

 2 or more years' overall development/technical support experience.

 Object oriented development experience in C++ and/or Java.

 Experience in UNIX/Linux operating system.

 Experience in database architecture and perform SQL queries.




Preferred Qualifications




 Other desired technical skills include Perl, Ruby, Python

 Proven ability to troubleshoot and identify the root cause of issues.

 Demonstrates skill and passion for operational excellence.


In joining our team, you'll enjoy a competitive salary, great benefits, a creative and comfortable work environment, and the exciting opportunity to be part of a fast-paced and growing technology company.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

Job ID: A1937435

job_title: Software Development Engineer II, FEX (Fulfillment Execution)
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrived, wondered how it got to you so fast? Did you ever think about where it came from? If solving complex problems while delighting customers is your passion, the Amazon Supply Chain Optimization organization is for you.

Watch this video to learn more about our organization, SCOT: http://bit.ly/amazon-scot

The Vancouver-based Fulfillment Execution (FEX) team, part of the SCOT Fulfillment Optimization group, owns systems responsible for executing customer orders by managing shipment life cycle from planning to fulfillment, orchestrating billions of worldwide shipments for Amazon. We build solutions that are central to the order and fulfillment pipelines and to the supply chain systems’ operation and impact core front-end customer facing functionality. In order to delight our customers, we rely on complex software systems which have to scale to meet Amazon's growing business needs.

As a Software Developer/Engineer on the FEX team, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining this large, complex software system. You will develop highly available, business impacting services at the core of Amazon's fulfillment engine. You will be empowered to think big, invent on behalf of our customers, and find elegant solutions to hard problems. You will also work closely with a diverse group of stakeholders from World-wide Operations, Finance, Fulfilled-By-Amazon, and internal technical teams to define business opportunities and then drive end-to-end solutions. The world is changing fast and this is a dynamic role where you will be able to learn as much as you contribute.

Successful candidates will be strong developers who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. You should enjoy working closely with your peers in a group of very smart and talented engineers. We have a team culture that encourages innovation, requires operational excellence, and expects developers and management alike to take a high level of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture and project delivery.




Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related technical discipline

 2+ years professional software design and development experience

 Proficiency with at least one Object Oriented language (e.g. Java, C++, C#).

 Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, automated testing, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis




Preferred Qualifications




 Development experience on cloud-scale, fault-tolerant distributed and service-oriented systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

 Ability to own all stages of development process: design, testing, implementation, operational support

 Solid programming skills with object oriented design and testing

 Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Lean software development experience

 Experience with an e-commerce, transportation, or big data company


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related technical discipline

 2+ years professional software design and development experience

 Proficiency with at least one Object Oriented language (e.g. Java, C++, C#).

 Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, automated testing, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis




Preferred Qualifications




 Development experience on cloud-scale, fault-tolerant distributed and service-oriented systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

 Ability to own all stages of development process: design, testing, implementation, operational support

 Solid programming skills with object oriented design and testing

 Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Lean software development experience

 Experience with an e-commerce, transportation, or big data company


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

A fast-growing AI startup seeks exceptionally talented software engineers to help shape the future of voice AI. The ability to learn new technologies and solve vague problems on a tight schedule is critical. Top-notch communication skills are essential. Expect to work with motivated and smart peers. Your compensation will include meaningful equity ownership.




Required Skills


Ability to influence, negotiate, and drive a vision without requiring authority

Proficiency in object-oriented design and design patterns

Practical understanding of data structures and algorithms

Experience building complex and extensible software





Preferred Skills


Ability to code in multiple languages

Proficiency with modern frontend libraries

Experience with cloud services

Working understanding of databases

Mobile development experience

industries: Leasing Real Estate
description:
A REWARDING CAREER AWAITS YOU AT THE TORONTO REGIONAL REAL ESTATE BOARD.


TRREB
 currently has an opportunity for an 
Network/Systems Administrator
 to fill a full-time, permanent position in the Information Services department. The successful candidate will report directly to the Manager, IT Operations and will be responsible for the duties outlined below.



Primary Responsibilities



The Network/Systems Administrator is responsible for end-user support, network administration, and systems administration. The incumbent will provide end-user technical support in-person and remotely and also deploy, maintain, and administer computer networks and all IT infrastructure components including end-user devices (computers, laptops, tablets, mobile phones), servers (Windows/macOS/Linux), systems software, web/application servers, network infrastructure components (switches, wireless APs, wireless controllers, firewalls) across all locations and environments. The incumbent will also develop, administer and maintain network and server infrastructure to the highest standard while ensuring security, integrity and high-availability of all enterprise systems and related components.

A creative thinker and fast learner with a calm, focused approach to problem-solving, positive attitude, client-oriented mindset, and excellent verbal and written communication skills are required.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES



Provide onsite and remote technical support for issues related to Windows/Mac devices (computers, laptops, and mobile devices), software applications, printers, peripherals, UPS, and components, liaising with hardware and software vendors, as required.

Resolve technical support tickets and requests in a timely and efficient manner based on priority and impact, including maintaining knowledgebase documentations.

Identify, diagnose, and resolve network problems including network connectivity, traffic utilization, etc. using available network tools in a timely fashion.

Build, maintain, monitor, and optimize Microsoft Windows/Linux/Mac servers in both a physical and virtual environment.

Maintain and administer LAN/WLAN/WAN network infrastructure components and services while ensuring that appropriate security measures are in place to avoid unauthorized access and reporting any unusual activity/access to the Manager, IT Operations.

Maintain a Microsoft Active Directory environment with Windows/Mac clients and Windows/Mac/Linux servers including managing Group Policies and all network services (Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, file/print sharing, SFTP, RADIUS, and Web services).

Configure and maintain network devices and solutions including Cisco Catalyst/Meraki switches, Cisco/Meraki access points, network printers, ASA firewalls, and enterprise endpoint protection, while ensuring that all enterprise systems and connectivity are adequately secured.

Routinely check network systems and equipment for substandard performance or malfunctioning, ensuring that any warning signs are quickly responded to and do not become major problems.

Properly apply system updates, patches, and configuration changes as per established procedures and best practices.

Liaise with service providers (WAN, VOIP, and Managed Services) to ensure availability of key systems and services.

Set up laptops/projectors/phone equipment for meetings/seminars as required.

Create, request, and present technical specifications and requirements for purchasing of new devices and solutions and coordinating with vendors and suppliers for IT purchases, solutions, and maintenance/support.

Participate in the creation, maintenance, testing, and execution of a Disaster Recovery plan and ensure that all end-user and server systems are appropriately backed up and reviewed regularly to ensure they are operating as required.

Maintain UPS, water and temperature sensors.

Set up user accounts, permissions and passwords,

Assist with communications and connectivity services, including Internet, VOIP, fax services, etc.

Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related with servers and network topology, equipment, and configurations, including network design and diagrams, and ensure the timely review and update of the documentation.

Frequently meet to review IT infrastructure processes and procedures, and recommend corrective actions needed to gain efficiencies and productivity.

Train staff on TRREB supported technologies.

Occasionally mentor and train junior IT staff on the team.

Assist with other TRREB special events, including on-site assistance as required.

Perform other duties as requested from time to time.




Education




REQUIREMENTS



Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Information Technology or related field of study.

Technical Certifications (Cisco, Microsoft, AWS, Azure, etc.) would be an asset.




Experience




4 to 5 years of hands-on experience providing IT support, systems administration, and infrastructure administration.

Expert knowledge of computer and server hardware and components. Proficient in configuring, installing, and troubleshooting systems running Windows 10, Windows Server 2008-2019, macOS, MS Office (on both Windows and Mac), and Office 365.

Intermediate experience in configuring, troubleshooting and administering Microsoft Active Directory, Group Policies, DHCP, DNS, VPN (IPsec/SSL), SSL/TLS, HTTP/HTTPS, switching and routing protocols (STP, EIGRP, VTP), and client- and server-based networking, and Cisco devices (switches, ASA firewalls, WLC, access points).

Experience in deploying functional networks (LAN, WLAN, WAN) and their associated technologies and protocols.

Strong experience in network/systems monitoring and management.

Must be interested in building expertise in the following technologies: Microsoft Office 365, Mobile Device Management, Windows Azure, Amazon Web Services, and VMware.

Excellent customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.

Organized, reliable, highly dedicated with a positive attitude.

Keen eye for detail with decision-making, problem solving, and analytical skills.

Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently.

Ability to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment.




Health And Safety Responsibilities



The incumbent will follow safe work procedures, knowing and complying with all health and safety regulations. Personal protection and safety equipment will be used if/when required. Any injury or illness, unsafe acts or unsafe conditions must be reported immediately to their Supervisor.


SPECIAL WORKING CONDITIONS



Occasional overtime, on-call support and after-hours work may be required.

Heavy lifting is required for this position. Must be able to lift and transport moderately heavy objects (computers, servers, devices, and printers) on a regular basis.

This position may be exposed to highly confidential material and/or information. Every effort must be made to ensure that sensitive information and/or materials that are critical in nature are properly stored and secured.

A reliable vehicle and valid Ontario driver’s license are required for occasional travel within the GTA.




How To Apply




Application Details


To apply for this position, please submit your cover letter, resume, and salary expectations to the attention of:

Claudia Pugliese

Manager, Human Resources

via e-mail: click apply


Please include "Network/Systems Administrator" in the subject line.



Note

:
 The COVID-19 vaccination (2 doses or more) is a condition of employment at TRREB unless you have a valid medical exemption pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code


As an employer committed to the principles of employment equity, we encourage applications from women, Indigenous peoples, visible minorities, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientation or gender identity. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free experience to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. To request accommodation during the recruitment process, please indicate this in your email.



While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those short-listed will be contacted.

industries: Software Development
description:
Do What You Love. Love What You Do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.


About The Team


As part of Workday’s Prism Analytics team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing techniques for high-performance query processing in support of big data analytics in the cloud. You will work with a top-notch team to implement features for parallel and distributed data processing engines. This includes developing efficient data structures and algorithms for massively parallel in-memory analytics, advanced techniques for distributed data processing, and integration with open-source distributed systems frameworks such as Spark. You will participate in the full life-cycle of software development and directly impact all the customers.


About The Role


You're an engineer who is passionate about data management and distributed data processing frameworks and algorithms. Performance, scalability, and reliability of these algorithms are constantly on your mind and looking to stay involved in these areas. You have the chops to build the infrastructure that powers high-performance data crunching on large volumes of data while ensuring simplicity and ease-­of­-use of the overall product. You enjoy the thrill of coming up with brilliant ideas and can articulate their value­-prop to stakeholders but are most satisfied when you turn these ideas into solid high­ quality implementations that make customers successful.


Learn More About Prism Analytics At Workday



https://youtu.be/V7tED4sf_ek

https://www.workday.com/en-us/applications/prism-analytics.html 




About You



Basic Qualifications



3+ years in database internals, query processing, and distributed systems

3+ years coding skills, Java, Scala, and Linux expertise




Other Qualifications



MS in Computer Science or related field and relevant software development experience or BS in Computer Science or related field and 3 years relevant software development experience

Desire to figure out how things work

Good grasp of SQL and distributed data processing



Bonus points if you have looked under the hood of Spark and changed the internals of how the framework works. Optimizing the Spark jobs completion time and scalability are part of the DNA of the team and we are looking to add engineers that will make the Spark engine as fast as a Ferrari.

As a federal contractor, Workday is requiring all new hires to verify that they are fully-vaccinated against COVID-19 within 72 hours of beginning employment with Workday, consistent with applicable law. Workday is an equal opportunity employer. Candidates who are not vaccinated due to a sincerely held religious belief, medical reasons, or other legally-protected reason should contact accommodations@workday.com to explore what, if any, reasonable accommodations or exemptions Workday is able to offer.

Pursuant to applicable Fair Chance law, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.


Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

job_title: Software Engineer in Test (SDET), Algorithms - Remote
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.


Software Engineer in Test (SDET), Algorithms




About The Team 



The Business Algorithms team at Kinaxis creates customized solutions to optimize supply chains. Ever wonder how the hundreds of parts in your new smart phone come together from different suppliers all over the world? Kinaxis solves problems like that every day.

Our customers have terabytes of data that needs to be analyzed for the largest supply chains imaginable. Our algorithms move the global economy-- in seconds, not hours, or days.

It’s Big Data with an impact; Data Science on the front lines.

The Algorithms team works in a dynamic environment where real life supply chain challenges are being translated into complex algorithms that are coded, tested and released to world-wide known manufactures. Developers and Test engineers are working together to achieve high quality supply chain solutions, develop Next Generation frameworks to address testing complexity, and interact with Product Managers and customers on a daily basis.

We believe in the DevOps culture – we serve our own tools, frameworks, infrastructure. Automation is certainly at the top of our priority list.


 Who you are 



You thrive on delivering a quality product to customers and care deeply about testing best practices and efficient test strategies.

You enjoy complex logic/algorithms, working with Big Data.

You are driven by customer success, love to participate in customer-facing projects.

You prefer a fast-paced agile work environment and take pride in finding product defects.

You approach testing with creative ideas and innovative techniques.

You collaborate with Software Developers and Product Managers, and your passion is to identify and solve product gaps.

You’re a strong believer in Continuous Integration, and the DevOps mindset

You communicate fluidly, at the level of your audience, and seek to understand and be understood.

You like working in teams, mentoring, and sharing neat things you come across. 



 What you will do 




Technical




Drive development/testing processes by introducing Next Generation frameworks

Enhance existing automation tools and test infrastructure

Design, develop, and support automated tests

Architect, implement and improve state of the art tools for Continuous Delivery.




Customer Facing




Learn Supply Chain business challenges and contribute to testing relevant Use Cases / Business Processes.

Participate in requirements elaboration and review product specifications.

Translate requirements into Test Strategies and Test Cases

Interact with Rapid Response customers directly and indirectly through Product Managers.




Process Oriented




Improve processes and efficiency of the team, always look for opportunities to strengthen the team.

Share your knowledge and mentor less experienced team members.




Team Player




 Be part of the amazing, collaborative, and supportive Business Algorithms Team that is practicing true Agile where QAs and developers share the same objectives. 



 What we are looking for  




Required




7+ years of experience in software test development and automation functions.

A degree in engineering and/or applied science.

Solid programming and scripting languages experience (Python, C#, .Net). 

Exceptionally strong analytical skills and experience working with complex data

Proficiency in requirements elaboration and test plans creation.

Ability to search for and structure information regarding complex processes / functionality.

The ability to ‘think outside of the box’ is crucial in this fast-paced environment 

Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Adaptable and flexible to changing priorities

Self-starter with strong initiative and results orientation




Definite Assets




Exposure to manufacturing/fulfillment/BI/Workforce Management/financial business requirements/practices. 

Knowledge of C++/Java

Familiarity with Jenkins CI/CD and release pipelines.

Knowledge and experience in relational database design and usage.

Experience working in agile development environment.



What we have to offer



Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.

Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.

Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.

 Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. 


For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

industries: Outsourcing and Offshoring Consulting
description:
We are currently seeking experienced Firmware/Embedded Software Engineers to join our team working on the next generation SSD solutions within our Core Firmware Engineering Group.

In this position, you will join a fast-paced team developing new, cutting-edge security firmware for SSDs. You will utilize and grow your experience in embedded architecture/design, develop production ready code, apply security algorithms/techniques, and develop unit, integration, and system tests to ensure quality. In addition, you will use and gain experience in the latest storage interface standards (ex. PCIe and NVMe) and industry security specifications (ex. from TCG, DMTF, OCP). The team utilizes Agile development methodologies, therefore, excellent communication skills and the ability to work closely with team members, both locally and across the organization is required.




As an experienced Firmware Engineer, the responsibilities may include, but not limited to the following:




- Design, develop, review, document, and maintain product source code in C/C++.



- Design and develop unit, integration, and system level testing in C/C++ and Python as part of development and validation phases.



- Debug and analyzes product issues across teams and disciplines (platform, transport, etc) to root cause and fix problems.



- Collaborate with functional leads and architects to develop or modify firmware architecture.



- Coach and mentor less experienced engineers in embedded development, systems architecture, RTOS, SW/FW best practices, etc.



- Work with internal and external customers to turn product requirements into designs and development/validation plans.



- Recommend priorities and coordinate activities with team members and external teams to accomplish committed milestones.



A successful candidate will demonstrate:



- Working successfully in different stages of a product lifecycle. This implies contributing to both the planning and technical aspects of the product.



- A history of self-starting and effective multitasking with strong communication (written and presentation) and leadership skills.



- Proven experience to listen, understand and respond professionally to stakeholder questions and issues while building trust.





Qualifications



Candidates must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.



- A bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or a related field.



- Development experience in an embedded or software systems environment with C/C++.



- Development experience in test and tool development with Python.



- Working knowledge for one or more of the following embedded development topics such as debuggers, real-time operating systems (RTOS), device drivers, and emulators.



Preferred Requirements:



- 5+ years of industry experience in embedded development or low-level/systems software.



- Experience working on a shipping product that includes an embedded environment with a RTOS and FW/HW interactions.



- Experience applying one or more of the following crypto algorithms: SHA, HMAC, KDF, ECDSA, and RSA.



- Experience working with industry security standards from one of the following organizations: TCG, DMTF, OCP, and FIPS.



- Experience with coaching or mentoring engineers which implies being well-versed in:



-- Development best practices such as coding standards, code reviews, continuous validation, on vs off target testing, etc.



-- Technical concepts and skills such as CPU caches/registers/interrupts, RTOS/multi-core designs and issues,  memory management, debugging with JTAG/gdb, etc.



- Experience with project and/or feature planning, work estimation, and risk management.



- Worked in the storage industry either building SSDs/HDDs or enterprise storage systems.

description:

Our clients are manufacturers of computer electronics systems for business. They have been around for a few decades and have employees globally. They are looking for software developers with good development skills in C# / .net.

OOP principles, software architecture design, debugging and performance tuning skills

description:
Backend Software Engineer III (Temporary - 1 year) 


Location: Remote open to most locations in North America



Job Summary



At Maxis, we're looking for a software engineer to work on cloud web services to help us bring exciting new features to life. You will work with an experienced team that has collectively built Maxis games for more than two decades. You will work with multiple designers, producers, and client engineers prototyping and shipping features that expand the gameplay possibilities of The Sims. You will report to a Development Director for the backend services team and the bulk of your work will be done in Java and Kotlin, using the Spring Boot framework, deployed to Kubernetes in the Google Cloud Platform.


 As a Backend Software Engineer at Maxis, you will 



 Develop responsive, resilient, massively scalable, and globally available web services that support millions of Sims players 

 Creatively blend security best practices and original techniques to keep user data secure and prevent cheating 

 Apply and improve service deployment and troubleshooting strategies that maximize uptime 

 Drive design and implementation of APIs and protocols that are consistent, formalized, and testable 

 Demonstrate excellent technical problem-solving skills under iteratively changing requirements during game development 

 Author and review technical design documents and API specifications detailing software requirements 

 Maintain a suite of automated tests that validate the correctness of backend services 

 Participate in 24-hour support of live environments 

 Participate in the upkeep and maintenance of live services 




Qualifications



Please note that you do not need to qualify for all requirements to be considered. We encourage you to apply if you can meet most of the requirements and are comfortable opening a dialog to be considered


 Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field. 

 3+ years of job experience in a hands on coding role 

 You've shipped and supported scalable web services hosted in the cloud 

 You own large systems and features from design to deployment, including live service support 

 You develop high-quality, testable software 

 You have a desire to work with client engineers and designers to iteratively add features and improve APIs 

 You develop APIs for products that release new updates with zero downtime strategies and tools 

 You have experience with load testing, troubleshooting, and optimizing performance of web services 

 You work on software that requires developing and optimizing queries and database access patterns 

 You're willing to iterate quickly and develop multiple short-lived prototypes 

 You have excellent written and verbal communication skills 

 You're a motivated self-starter; able to operate with autonomy 

 You have a desire to teach and learn from your peers 



 Pluses 



 You have experience developing services that support mobile applications 

 You've worked in the games industry before 

 You've built software with Java or Kotlin 

 You've shipped services using the Spring Boot Framework 

 You've worked on large teams using version control tools like Git 

 You've deployed web services using Kubernetes and containerization 

 You have experience with Google Cloud Platform, including Google Kubernetes Engine, or Google Cloud Spanner 

 You have experience with distributed streaming technologies like Kafka 

 You've shipped web services that scale to millions of daily users 

 You have experience working in large data-driven services
